El arduo trabajo de la señora Maria ha logrado sacar adelante su negocio y a su familia. En tus manos esta el crecimiento de esta mercería y el bienestar de esta familia, no lo dudes más y decídete a apoyarlos.

loans.use: Buy a refrigerator

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Cesario

texts.es:
My name is Cesario A. and I am dedicated to the sales of sandals and flip-flops, I have had my own business for one year. My clients are very good especially given the fact that I live in a place where it is very hot and the people buy a lot of this type of footwear because it is cool and comfortable. My goal is to increase my inventory to be able to offer a wider variety of products. With greater earnings I would be able to feed my children, my wife, and my future son that will soon be born.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

Mi nombre es Cesario A. me dedico a la venta de zandalias y chancletas, tengo mi negocio hace un año, mis clientes son buenos ya que en el lugar en donde vivo hace mucha calor y la gente compra mucho este tipo de calzado porque es comodo y fresco, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener mayor variedad de producto, y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mis hijos, mi esposa y mi futuro hijo que esta por llegar.

loans.use: purchase of sandals and flip-flops

loans.name: Amélia António

texts.pt:
Amélia António M. is 54 years old, single, and a mother of 3 children. She lives in the Luis Cabral neighborhood of Maputo. She is a fashion designer and sews various articles of clothing. She entered the program in November 2006 with an initial loan for 3,000MT. She is in the third loan cycle requesting a loan for 5,000MT to be repaid within 5 months. The amount is to purchase various raw materials such as fabric, thread, zippers, etc. She has deposited savings in each of the previous cycles. It is not easy to determine the growth of her business because she has not been in the program for very long. She has deposited savings above the required amount.

Translated from Potuguese by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Amélia António M., tem 54 anos de idade, é solteira e mãe de 3 filhos. Vive no bairro Luís Cabral em Maputo. É Modista e confecciona roupa diversa.Entrou no programa em Novembro de 2006 tendo tomado 3.000MT no primeiro empréstimo.Vai para o 3º ciclo de empréstimo e pretende tomar 5.000 MT para pagar em 6 meses. O montante é para ser aplicado na compra de diverso material como tecidos, linhas, Zips, etc.Tem depositado as poupanças em todos os ciclos. Ainda não é fácil identificar as mudanças em termos de progressão no negócio pois está a pouco tempo no programa, contudo, tem poupado acima da taxa obrigatória.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Reyhan

texts.en: Reyhan is a 33 year-old widow with 3 children. She lives in Seyidlar village, in the Khachmaz region. Reyhan has had this business for three years.  She has been growing vegetables, in order to support her family. Now she needs a loan of $725 to purchase seedlings.

loans.use: To buy seedlings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Inobat

texts.en: Inobat K. lives in Mastchokh; she is married and has 4 children. She is an active client of MicroInvest since 2005. She recommends herself as a serious and experienced client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures. She is engaged in the commercial services and trade. She has a business in street trading (home products for every day). Inobat K. works in the bazaar. She has a broad assortment, but working in the bazaar, she meets hard competitors. That is why she wants to broaden her existing assortment. Now, Mrs.K. requires a loan for 2800 STJ, for business support and expansion of inventory, which allows her to increase the family income and to continue her children's education.

loans.use: For business support and widening the assortment of goods.

loans.name: Fatuma's Kota Group

texts.en:
Fatuma, age 51, is a widow taking care of two children, ages 6 and 8. She has a business of selling charcoal which she started a year ago. She works from 6am to 6pm daily and now makes a monthly profit of about $18 from her sales.

Fatuma was able to start this charcoal business with a loan from BRAC Tanzania. She now hopes for another loan to increase her charcoal sales. She will share this loan with her subgroup, who have businesses dealing in clothes, books, and fabric sales.

loans.use: To buy charcoal stock

loans.name: Rovshen

texts.en: Rovshen E. and his family (his father is pictured) operate a dairy product stand in the bazaar, located in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. Rovshen is 22 years old and has been working in this business for the last 4 years. Rovshen has already successfully repaid one prior loan with Norwegian Microcredit. He is currently looking for funding to expand and diversify his inventory.

loans.use: To expand and diversify his inventory

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is a 43-year-old mother of 4 children. She has been instrumental in providing water to her community. Without her efforts, her community would not have easy access to safe drinking water. With her first loan through Sinapi Aba Trust, she was able to lay water pipe from the main city pipeline to her business. With her second loan, she is now hoping to build a permanent bathhouse in her community and to finance her purchase of a new water tank. Comfort has 4 assistants, who help her with distributing her water in the community and in the local market.

Comfort is a member of the trust group "God Is One." The trust group works on the principle that peer pressure exerted by each member on other members will help secure repayments.

loans.use: To purchase materials to build a public bathhouse and to finance her purchase of a water tank

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Ms. P. has handled five credits with which she has improved her business and has since grown her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

La señora P. ha manejado cinco creditos en los cuales ha mejorado su negocio ya que a crecido su inventario.

loans.use: Purchase of General Merchandise

loans.name: Teresa Quiasse

texts.en:
Teresa is 43 years old and originally from Magude, in the Maputo Province. She is married and has 5 children. Her two oldest children live in Swaziland with their father and are attending university and the three smaller children live with her and go to school in Boane. Teresa studied until 5th grade and stopped due to her family’s difficult financial situation. She moved with her family to Boane, a village 30Km away from the capital city Maputo, a long time ago. Teresa has had a small stand in front of her house since 1983, at which she sells ice creams, soft drinks and basic needs products.

As her stand's business is quite unstable, she decided to start rearing chickens 3 years ago and has been successful so far. Teresa built a quite large henhouse in her backyard, where she now raises 1,000 chicks at a time. She buys the chicks and chicken feed in Maputo and pays someone to bring them to her house. After a 30-day maturity period Teresa sells each chicken for MTn 85. Clients normally go to her henhouse directly to buy chickens, but she sometimes transports them to the village center as well. Teresa counts on the help of her older daughter to run the stand, and they make between MTn 500 to MTn 1,000 per day. Teresa’s husband is a policeman and also helps with the house’s expenses and with the children’s school fees.

This will be Teresa’s first loan with Hluvuku and Kiva. She will use the MTn 20,000 to buy chickens, chicken feed and vaccines in large quantity to stock. She heard about Hluvuku and decided to ask for this loan, as she wants to improve her business. In future Teresa would like to build a new general store to sell food and other products.

loans.use: Buy chicks, and also food and vaccines to stock

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua A. sells fresh fish. She is married, but her husband's income from fishing is not sufficient for Ekua and her 2 children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Mohamed's Group

texts.en:
Mohamed K. (left), born in Makale, 35 years old, and married with 3 children. He works for the military and engages in agricultural activities. He will use his share of the loan to buy seeds and expand his farm.

Next to him is Abu S.. He was born in Port Loko 24 years ago. He is married with 2 children. He will use his loan to expand his food business.

Foday T. (second to right) is 34 years old and was born in  Pujenhun. He is married with 4 children.  Foday`s wife sells cooked rice, and Foday will use his loan to expand his wife's business. Like his colleagues, Foday will be repaying his loan out of his monthly military salary.

Borbor S. (right) is 25 years old, born in Kamabai. He currently works in Makeni with the military. Borbor will use his loan to get started in farming, a long-time dream of his,

These men are requesting a loan of Le 3,600,000.00 to improve their incomes and better provide for their families.

loans.use: To buy seed rice for farming, and expand their different businesses.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José drives “trufi 1” (a trufi is a taxi with a fixed route), traveling from the southern zone to the center of the city of La Paz. He is single and lives with his parents in the El Pedregal zone (La Paz). The loan would be used for the maintenance of his vehicle and to purchase tires. This is the third time he seeks a loan through IMPRO, having settled his previous loans in a satisfactory manner. His previous history allows him access to this credit, as it will be a great help to him and increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva volunteer.

José es chofer del trufi 1 (trufi es un taxi con ruta fija), su recorrido abarca desde la zona sur hasta el centro de la ciudad de La Paz. Es soltero y vive en la casa de sus padres, zona de El Pedregal (La Paz). El crédito será destinado para el mantenimiento completo de su vehiculo y la compra de llantas. Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, el cumplimiento en los anteriores préstamos fue bueno. Sus antecedentes e historial le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que será de gran ayuda y aumentará sus ingresos.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Elizabeth inicio el negocio porque quiere superarse y desarrollarse, además de apoyar en los gastos familiares a su esposo. Ella tiene 3 años dedicándose a la venta de productos de plástico para el hogar, y tiene la meta de ser distribuidora local de ese producto, con esfuerzo esta creciendo el número de clientes.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar más mercancía y poder distribuirla. Con tu ayuda Elizabeth lograra su meta.
texts.en:
Elizabeth started her business because she wanted to overcome her difficulties and develop herself, in addition to supporting her family's expenses along with her husband. She has worked on the sale of home plastic products for 3 years now, and her goal is of becoming the local distributor, and to grow the number of customers.

She is requesting a loan of U.S. $ 250, which she plans to pay in 3 months, and will use the loan to buy more goods to distribute. With your help Elizabeth will reach her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more products.  (comprar mercancia)

loans.name: Moriya

texts.ru: Кодирова Мория жительница Файзабадского района. Замужем и имеет шестерых детей. Домохозяйка, занимается разведением домашнего скота. Дело приносит доход , но она хочет увеличить поголовье скота , путем возможного кредита.  Развитие бизнеса поможет ей увеличить доход, а так же расширить дело. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев
texts.en:
Moriya Q. lives in the Faizabad region. She is married and has six children. She is a housewife who also breeds cattle at home. This business brings in good income, but she wants to increase the headcount of cattle by getting a loan. By developing her business she will increase her profits and also expand her business. She plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina raises a 16-year-old daughter. She tries to provide her with everything she needs, which is why Marina works hard to keep up with financial challenges and keep her business running. Marina sells women’s clothing items in one of the busiest markets in Simferopol, Ukraine. The inventory she sells is very high quality. Even though her prices are a little higher than average, Marina has gained many loyal customers who keep coming back to buy clothes from her.  

Marina has been in business for about 20 years. The loans she has received and promptly repaid with Nadiya Ukraine have promoted consistent increase in her sales and profits. Currently, she has around 6,000 Grivnas of working capital. Her net profit is about 2,000 Grivnas every month. Marina has requested a loan for 5,000 Grivnas to help open a new vending kiosk and expand her trade. She is hoping that this loan will have a positive impact on her business profitability and help her further improve the economic and social situation of her family.

loans.use: Open a new vending facility

loans.name: Nuevo Progreso Group

texts.en: "Nuevo Progreso" is a large group of borrowers from Esperanza International. Right now there are 13 hopefuls looking for another loan. Priseida is the representative of this group and also one of the group leaders. She was chosen because she is an extremely faithful and trustworthy person. She is the mother of four children and runs a small beauty salon. Before her first loan she was barely able to take care of her children, but now can proviD. food each day and even save for the future, such as her children's education. Priseida hopes she can make enough to send them all to college. She has been increasing her business at a steady pace, and feels like this next loan will take her to a new level. She is excited about her business and excited to have something to call her own. She feels like she is on the path to a better life and wants nothing more than a better future for her loved ones. The whole group is excited about this loan and ready for the challenge!

loans.use: To buy products for the salon

loans.name: Rosa Luz

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “Wiñay” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 46 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos menores de edad. 
Con su primer préstamo de S/. 300 compró productos de belleza, chocolates y lácteos. Tiene casi 3 años trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que el banco le permitió cambiar de rubro a su negocio en diferentes oportunidades para ahora dedicarse a servicio de turismo. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, continuará capacitándose para mejorar su negocio.
Rosa desea continuar trabajando para capitalizarse y ser independiente de préstamos.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the “Wiñay” community bank in the district, province and department of Puno. She is 46 years old, married, and has 3 minor children. With her first loan of 300 soles, she purchased beauty products, chocolates, and cheeses. She has been working with the community bank for almost 3 years and tells us that the bank has allowed her to change her line of business to seize opportunities such as currently to dedicate herself to tourism services. With this 3,000.00 soles loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will receive training to improve her business. Rosa wants to continue working to make more money and become debt-free.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To receive training to improve her business.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy O. sells provisions, drinks, yams and garri. She plans to increase her stock to increase her profits to enable her to take good care of her children and pay their school fees. She is 43 years old, married with 6 children. She is requesting a loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more yams, garri, provisions and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, provisions, yams and garri to sell

loans.name: Las Flores 5 And 6 Group

texts.en:
Sonia Maria F. and Luisa Marte are group coordinators for the Las Flores Bank of Hope in Los Alcarrizos. Sonia has 7 children living in her home, and Luisa has 3 children in her home. El Progreso bank members have been participating in the Esperanza loan program for up to a year. Sonia will be using her loan to buy food products and inventory for her fried food stand and her variety store. For her variety store, Sonia will be specifically investing in buying bedding products.

Luisa's micro business is clothing sales. She purchases her wares in Santo Domingo, and brings them back to her community. Previous to taking out microloans, these women could not run their own sustainable businesses. Sonia was employed as a domestic worker, and Lusia in a factory. Neither women saw much of a future in either of those employment activities, and agree that working for themselves shows much more promise and more profit.

In the future, Sonia mentions that she would like to grow her business and upgraD. her home with cement block installation. Lusia would like to make similar improvements to her home, and perhaps expand her business venture into a cafeteria.

Thank you for supporting these entrepreneurs!

loans.use: Purchase new merchandise for resale

loans.name: Elflida

texts.en:
Elflida J. is a rice grower. She is 34 years old and has 3 children. She has been a farmer ever since she was a child. Now that she has a new family, she works very hard to provide her children a good future. She previously worked as an attendant in a small store. She was not happy about her job, so she wound up managing her own farm.

She is asking a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy Brudon chemicals for her farm. Brudon is something that could enrich the soil. She believes that her loan will bring her a good harvest. In this way, she could contribute well to the family income.

CEVI provides people a chance to start their own businesses. They give all their clients credit assistance, training and insurance coverage to help them run their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase Brudon Chemicals and fertilizer for the farm

loans.name: Elena Marisol

texts.es: La señora Elena Marisol L. M. tiene la edad de 31 años, su estado civil es casada. La ubicación del negocio de Doña Elena es su vivienda. La actividad económica de Doña Elena es venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que necesitaba ganar los ingresos necesarios para la sufragar los gastos de su hogar. Los propósitos de Doña Elena  son de mantener su negocio activo para seguir ayudando a su familia. El financiamiento que solicita Doña Elena es para capital de trabajo y así poder comprar ropa para niños, damas y caballeros, además de cremas, perfumes, pinturas de labios y pinturas de uñas. Los sueños de Doña Elena son de poseer un negocio estable para que el día de mañana sus hijos puedan administrarlo. La cantidad que solicita es de C$10.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elena Marisol L. M. is 31 years old and she is married. The location of Doña Elena's business is her home. She makes a living by selling general merchandise. She started this business seven years ago because she needed to earn money to be able to support her family. Doña Elena's objective is to continue to keep her business active and profitable so that she can continue to help her family. The financing that she is asking for is so that she can invest capital in her business and thus be able to buy clothing for children, ladies and gentlemen, in addition to creams, perfumes, lipsticks and nail polishes to sell. Doña Elena's dream is to own a profitable and stable business so that in the future her children can run it. She is requesting a loan of $500.

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for Business

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.en:
Hợp Lê (1328050250) is a 35-year-old female living in the town of Hưng Nguyen. She is married and has two infant children. To making a living, Hợp owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. Her business’s main source of revenue is raising and selling pigs, however raising pigs is not the business's only means of generating revenue. Hợp has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000,000 VND per month from these activities.

In 2005, Hợp joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Hợp has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Hợp is now requesting a new loan of 16,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to be raised and sold in future. The loan will be the fourth loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. Hợp plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: Raising pigs

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en:
Kamal A. J. is 28-years-old, married, and has five children. He lives in Nablus city, Palestine. For a living, Kamal sells coffee and tea in a kiosk, which he owns. With this activity he helps support his children and cover the family needs. 
Kamal is requesting a loan for US $1000 to expand his business by increasing his working capital. He and his family are very grateful for the support that you give to allow them to continue their business and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to expand his business, increasing his working capital

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
"My husband often goes out fishing so that he will have plenty of fish that I could sell. We have a boat. Fishing is the only thing that supports our family. In God's mercy we were able to pay little by little our debts. I wish that we could add fishing boats so that we could be able to send our children to school," says Ligaya T., a 44-year old mother of eight children.

She would like to ask for a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy pangal, a fishing material that is efficient for a good catch. She also considers expanding her business even more.

CEVI is reaching out a lot Filipino community members to start and have their own businesses. CEVI gives not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy pangal, a  fishing material

loans.name: Anoko

texts.fr: Cette femme a associé à son métier d’infirmière accoucheuse  le commerce des produits génériques et pharmaceutiques. Ainsi elle permet aux malades n’ayant pas assez d’argent pour acheter les médicaments à la pharmacie de l’acheter chez elle. Son stock de marchandises est épuisé et elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter des produits génériques et pharmaceutiques.
texts.en:
This woman is both a nurse-midwife and a vendor of generic and pharmaceutical products. Thus, she allows ill people who don't have enough money to buy medicines at the pharmacy to buy from her. Her inventory of medicines is expended and she wants to replenish it. She is asking WAGES for her first loan to buy generic and pharmaceutical products.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of generic and pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 59 years old. She is widowed and has three children. All her children are currently working. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, skimmed powdered milk and biscuits etc. in her neighborhood. It has been her dream to make an expansion by adding other foodstuffs to her existing products. With the loan, she wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits etc to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve her savings to support herself for old age. She would be grateful for your assistance and belongs to the village bank called ‘Nyamedaye’ which means God never sleep.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for her store

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La señora Luisa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santiago Apóstol”  que esta ubicado en el del distrito de Paucarcolla, Provincia de San Román, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 30 años de edad, estado civil casada, es madre de 04 hijos  y tiene estudios de primaria completa.  Vive en el Jr. Collado.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 6 años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para la compra de golosinas. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de harina para elaboración de pan.  Paralelamente se dedica a la crianza de ganado menor.

Su deseo es poner una tienda de venta de abarrotes al por mayor.

A ella le gusta la facilidad en los préstamos y losa ahorros
texts.en:
Luisa is a member of the Santiago Apostol Communal Bank which is located in the Paucarcolla district, San Roman Province, Puno Department. She is 30 years old, married and the mother of 4 children. She completed elementary school. She has cooperated with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past 6 years; her initial 300 new soles loan being used to purchase snacks. At this time, she needs a 1000 new soles loan to purchase flour to bake bread. As a parallel activity she raises young livestock. Her goal is to open a wholesale grocery store. She likes the ease of loans and savings.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase flour.

loans.name: Marcelinda

texts.en:
Marcelinda J. is a 45-year old rice grower in Veruela, Agusan Del Sur. She has four children and a supportive husband who manages their farm. Her hopes and plans for the future is to have another area for rice. She also mentioned  the education of her children and providing them a bright future.

Marcelinda wants a loan to buy seedlings, complete fertilizers, herbicides, and insecticides. Because she was very worried about where is she going to look for money to finance her business, when she learned about the CEVI credit program, she never hesitated to apply for a small amount. which is really what she needs for her business operations.

Now she attends the CEVI cluster meetings which are managed by CEVI borrowers. They elect officers in their organizations. In their gathering, they learn about community business and savings, in addition to loans, training and the insurance coverage that they received.

loans.use: To buy seedlings, complete fertilizers, herbicides and insecticides

loans.name: By The Grace Of God Group

texts.en:
Here are members of By the Grace of God group. They are small scale businesspeople base in Magburaka town, in northern Sierra Leone. In order to improve their businesses, they have applied for a loan of Le 500,000 for each from SMT/Kiva. 

Ibrahim S. (middle) is the leader of this group. Ibrahim is forty-six years of age, born in Kambia district, in northern Sierra Leone. Ibrahim is married to a businesswoman and they have seven children together. Some of his children are attending secondary schools and others in primary schools. Ibrahim is a tailor and has been in this business for many years now. He will use this loan to expand his business by buying sewing materials.

loans.use: Invest into his tailoring business

loans.name: Delma

texts.en:
Delma G. is a single, 52-year-old woman from the village of Palilan, Jimenez, in the province of Misamis Occidental, Philippines. To make a living, Delma owns and operates a business in the food sector selling fish. Her main source of income comes primarily from buying and selling fish in the local community. Delma has been involved in this business for over 20 years, and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Delma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation, and ability to engage in business activities. Delma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. This loan was used to purchase additional fish to sell.

Delma is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be invested in the expansion of her business. This will be Delma's third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Invest in business expansion

loans.name: Kiko

texts.es:
Kiko es un joven soltero de 25 años, es muy trabajador y vive en la casa de su madre. Se dedica a la agricultura desde niño, es por ello que le causa gran complacencia trabajar en sus cultivos, ya que cada vez que siembra es muy cuidadoso y paciente, pues sólo así logra  cosechar productos limpios y sin gusanos, para que no se malogren cuando estén guardados. Cada una de sus cosechas las lleva a un depósito en la ciudad donde llegan los compradores de la costa y logra obtener buen precio por sus papas, según el tamaño y la variedad de semilla. Estas ganancias las comparte con sus padres y hermanos y eso lo hace sentir muy feliz. Por ello, está pensando, para un futuro cercano, comprar sus propios terrenos, para que de ese modo sus hermanos menores siembren en las chacras de sus padres también.
Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, por lo que está muy agradecido, ya que cada crédito le ha sido de mucha ayuda, por tal motivo también asiste puntualmente a todas las reuniones de su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita será para la compra de fertilizantes químicos para su siguiente siembra de papas.
texts.en:
Kiko is a very hard working 25 year-old single man who lives with his mother. He has worked in agriculture since he was a child and he enjoys working on his crops. He is very careful and patient with each crop as it is the only way to harvest clean products, without worms, that will not spoil when they are in storage. He sells his harvest at a warehouse in the city to buyers from the coast, and he obtains good prices for his potatoes, based on the size and seed variety. He shares his earnings with his parents and siblings and it makes him very happy. He is thinking of buying his own land in the near future, so that his younger siblings can also work in his parents’ small subsistence farm.

This is his eight loan with MFP and he is very appreciative since each loan has been a great help. He has been very punctual to his community bank’s meetings. The funds that he is requesting will be used to purchase chemical fertilizers for his next potato crop.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es: Manuel De Jesús M. reside en el departamento de Santa Ana. Manuel tiene 51 años de edad vive con su dos hijos Salvador y Diego que tienen 18 años de edad, y se encuentran estudiando. Manuel tiene un panadería que abrió hace cinco años y la que hoy le da estabilidad económica a su familia, Manuel recibe apoyo de sus hijos que por las tardes libres después de la escuela , ayudan en el negocio familiar, su clientela es muy estable ya que la panadería se encuentra ubicada en calle principal con mucha afluencia. El crédito que solita Manuel es para compra insumos que le permitan aumentar su producción de pan.

loans.use: Compra de insumos

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Em S., 40, is a widow with two young children. She lives in Phnom Penh. Since 1991, she has been making and selling cakes at the local market to earn a living. She is able to make about US$5 of profit every day and is aided by one of her children who is a garment factory worker. Em S. would like to take out a loan of US$600. She needs to purchase rice and more ingredients to make her cakes.

loans.use: To purchase rice and ingredients to make cake.

loans.name: Kimsean

texts.en:
Mr. Kimsean T., age 52, and his wife, Mrs. Chamroeun Chan, age 46, live in a small village along National Road Number Three about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1983 and have three sons. One of them is married, one is a construction worker and the other one is in school.

Kimsean has been a soldier since 1981, while his wife is a cleaner. He is applying for his first loan of US$ 1,000 in order to purchase a shop for his daughter-in-law to sell grocery items.

loans.use: To buy a shop for his daughter in-law to sell grocery items

loans.name: Mohammad Hakim

texts.en:
The man who is pictured is M. Hakim, the son of M. R.. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. His family consists of seven members.

He works in a retail shop through which he supports all of his family members. Since he is a part of a big family, and has a lot responsibility for them, he has requested an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani to repair most of his house parts which were damaged. He wants to repair his house as soon as possible because winter is very near. 

He would like to say that Kiva is an effective process which can support all those who need money around Afghanistan.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Bienvenida

texts.en:
Bienvenida R. is from the village of Migpange Bonifacio Misamis Occ. She is 45 years old. Bienvenida is married and has 4 school-aged children. Bienvenida owns & operates a business that sells seafood products including fish, shrimp, and crabs in the local community. Bienvenida has been in business for over 3 years and makes a monthly income of approximately 4,500 Philippine pesos (PHP), which is about $97 US.

In 2008, Bienvenida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bienvenida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Bienvenida is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and to pay for daily needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en:
Ramil C. is from the village of Sumalag, Kinoguitan, Misamis Oriental. He is 42 years old. Ramil is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Ramil owns and operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Ramil has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ramil joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ramil is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ramil from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Maria Rosibel

texts.es:
la joven Maria Rosibel V. tiene 22 años de edad, vive en el Barrio San Jose de la ciudad de Nacaome,  se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, tiene su negocio en su casa de habitacion, con las ventas de la navidad se quedo con poca mercaderia y ahora necesita comprar mas para tener mayores ventas.
las ganancias que tuvo las invirtio en su casa de habitacion y en su hijo.
ahora necesita hacer crecer su negocio un poco para poder cubrir con los gastos mensuales de su hogar.
nos comento que este negocio es muy bueno ya que la ropa que viene en los fardos es ropa de marca y de buena calidad, la mayoria esta en buen estado.
dice que su meta es poder hacer crecer su negocio y hacerlo una tieda grande de ropa.
muchos clientes la prefieren porque vende su producto a un precio justo para las personas que viven en esta comunidad.
texts.en:
The young Maria Rosibel V. is 22 years old and lives in the San Jose neighborhood in the city of Nacaome. She sells used clothing out of her home. The Christmas season sales left her with little merchandise, and now she needs to purchase more so that she can have greater sales. The earnings that she got were invested in her home and also in her son. Now she needs to grow her business a little so that she can cover the monthly expenses of her household. She tells us that business is good, and that the bales of clothing that come are brand-name and of good quality, and the majority of items are in good condition. She says that her goal is to be able to grow her business and make it into a large clothing store. Many customers prefer her business because she sells her products at a fair price for the people who live in this community.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy used clothing in bulk

loans.name: San Juan De Orcasitas Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Juan D. Orcasitas, inicia su quinto ciclo con 19 socias. Las socias son D. la Comunidad D. Orcasitas que se ubica a 30 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. 

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. abarrotes en general, cochinilla, tara, comida, fabricación D. ladrillos, animales D. menores y servicio D. transporte.

Como es el caso D. la señora Lourdes es conviviente y tiene 29 años, Lourdes tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los dias, Lourdes necesita un préstamo D. 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar.

Mientras que Paulina es casada y tiene 36 años, Paulina junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación D. ladrillos D. manera artesanal, sus ventas los realiza en el mismo lugar, Paulina necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. tierra.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600soles, 750 soles, 900 soles  haciendo un total D. 11,700 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, leña, tara, cochinilla, tierra, carne, animales menores.

Los sueños D. las socias son que sus hijos sean profesionales, mejorar sus negocios, comprar un carro para transportar sus productos.
texts.en:
The Community Bank of San Juan D. Orcasitas is starting its fifth loan cycle with 19 members from the community of Orcasitas, which is located 30 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. The members have different businesses, including ones that sell general groceries, make bricks, raise small animals, and are involved in public transportation. Lourdes lives with her common-law husband, is 29 years old and has a store out of her home where she sells general groceries, which she does every day. Lourdes needs a loan of 900 soles, which she plans to invest in the purchase of rice and sugar. Meanwhile, Paulina is married and is 36 years old. Paulina and her husband together make a living making artisan bricks and sell them in the same place. She is requesting a loan of 600 soles, which she plans to use to purchase land. The members need different amounts of the loan, such as 300 soles, 600 soles, 750 soles and 900 soles, for a grand total of 11,700 soles for the community bank. The loans will be use to invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, firewood, regional fruit, stoves, land, meat and small animals. The members' dreams are for their children to be successful, to improve their businesses and to purchase a car to transport their products.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, firewood, regional fruit, stoves, land, meat and small animals

loans.name: Na We Cam Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the 'Na We Cam' Group. The leader of the group is Alaymatu K.. She has been a businesswoman for many years now. Alaymatu sells bars of soap and cakes. She is 35 years of age. She is married to a professional worker and they have 4 children, all of whom are in primary school. Alaymatu was born in Makeni. She will use this loan to further expand her business. She will use it to buy soap and cake-making materials. 

Members of the 'Na We Cam' group are all local entrepreneurs in Makeni city.  This will be the first loan these entrepreneurs will be accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to further expand their businesses, make more sales and better profit, and consequently improve their living standards by sending their children to school, feeding themselves and their children, buying clothing, etc.

loans.use: Buy soap and cake-making materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional vegetables and fruits for her genge.

loans.name: Magda Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Magda Elizabeth B. es maestra de educación superior en la universidad UPONIC Esteli.
Magda va usar este crédito para pago de mano de obra por la construcción de un cuarto.
Ella espera que con el pago de la mano de obra pueda construir su cuarto ya que lo esta necesitando y así condicionar su casa.
Magda es casada y no tiene hijo. Este es su segundo crédito con Ceprodel y tiene dos años de estar trabajando con Ceprodel ella dijo que los créditos le han ayudado mucho a mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Magda teaches at UPONIC Esteli University. She will use the money from this loan to pay for labor needed to build an extra room that she needs in her home. She is married but has no children. This will be her second loan through CEPRODEL and has been working with CEPRODEL for two years. She said that the loans have been a great help toward improving her home.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor for construction

loans.name: Wendy Guissel

texts.es: LA SEÑORA WENDY GUISSEL P. ES CASADA MADRE DE UN NIÑO DE 5 AÑOS EL CUAL ASISTE A LA ESCUELA , LA SEÑORA LABORA COMO GERENTE DE AGENCIAS EN SAN RAFAEL DE L SUR.DURANTE EL TIEMPO QUE HA LABORADO CON CEPRODEL HA SABIDO APROVECHAR LA OPORTUNIDA YA QUE LE HAN SERVIDO PARA MEJORAR SU CSA Y MEJORA SU NIVE DE VIADA.
texts.en:
Mrs. Wendy is a married mother with a 5-year-old boy who attends school. Wendy works as manager of agencies in San Rafael del Sur. During the time she has worked with CEPRODEL, she has known how to take advantage of the opportunity. She has used her loans to improve her house as well as her standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PAYING MEDICAL EXPENSES

loans.name: Pedro Luis

texts.es: Este cliente es originario del Municipio de Cinco Pinos el crédito será destinado para compra de materiales de construcción, tales como ladrillos, bloques,  laminas de zinc para cubrir el techo de su casita, ha salido adelante gracias a los créditos que ha obtenido y su familia la ha sacado a delante.
texts.en:
Este cliente es originario del Municipio de Cinco Pinos el crédito será destinado para compra de materiales de construcción, tales como ladrillos, bloques, laminas de zinc para cubrir el techo de su casita, ha salido adelante gracias a los créditos que ha obtenido y su familia la ha sacado a delante.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para comprar compra de materialez de contruccion, tales como ladrillos, cemento

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok S., 48, is married and resides with her husband and a twenty-eight year old child in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. She sells various kinds of groceries for an income of about $2 per day. Her husband is a mechanic, earning an average income of $2 per day to help cover the family expenses.  

She is requesting a loan of $500 to buy a plot of farmland to grow rice. This is her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a plot of farmland

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda S. is from the village of Santa Rita. She is 51 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Imelda owns and operates a business providing repair services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Imelda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This loan will be her fourth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie L. is from the village of Capayangan, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 37 years old. Josie is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Josie owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Josie has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 25,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Josie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Josie is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Josie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her house. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn S. J. is from the village of lilon bonifacio. She is 45 years old. Merlyn is married and has 3 school-age children. To make a living, Merlyn owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as vinegar, shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Merlyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Merlyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mariana Lucrecia

texts.es:
Mariana de 35 años, vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada las orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas), ella elabora y vende peluches de felpa. 

Empezó trabajando en un taller de confecciones de peluches, cuando aprendió hacer al por mayor lo peluches decidió independizarse y ganar su propio dinero, poco a poco con esfuerzo y la ayuda de su pareja pudo tener su propio negocio, ahora trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 16h00pm todos los días. 

Para tener una mayor producción de peluches ella quiere comprar con el préstamo tela, lana, algodón. En el futuro quiere tener un taller de confección con empleados que le ayuden.
texts.en:
Mariana, 35, lives in Guayaquil’s Las Orquídeas (orchids) neighborhood (an urban zone so-called because when it was discovered there were a lot of orchids there). She makes stuffed toys out of felt to sell. She started out as an employee in a stuffed toy workshop. When she learned how to make the items in quantity she decided to become independent and earn her own money. Gradually, with effort and help from her life partner, she was able to get her own business. Now, she works from 8am until 4pm every day. In order to increase production, she needs funds to buy wool and cotton fabric. In the future, she’d like to have a manufacturing workshop with employees to help her.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool and cotton fabric.

loans.name: Mamlekat

texts.en:
Mamlekat T. is a 53-year old widow. She was born in a family of farmers and from early childhood had to help her parents in farming.   Mamlekat got married at the age of 20 and gave a birth to two sons. She moved to her husband’s home in Stepnoe village, where they lived with his elderly parents. Her husband worked on a  large state farm where Mamlekat got a job of dairymaid. He helped her in all her activities.  Later, they were able to buy a small house in Kara-Balta town (near the village). This couple worked hard to support their children. But in 1987, Mamlekat lost her support when an incurable disease caused her husband death. 

She became the only breadwinner for her family. Mamlekat, being courageous woman, remained firm in her wish to provide a good future for her children. Her salary didn’t cover all her family’s expenses, so she decided to start her own business.  In 1999, Mamlekat sold her house in the town and bought a dairy yard near her Stepnoe village. At that time, Mamlekat  had only several calves, later her livestock grew and she got milk cows.  Mamlekat’s family had revenues from selling their dairy products.  Today, Mamlekat has ten milk cows and ten bull-calves. Now Mamlekat requests a loan of 60,000 Kyrgyz Soms  to enlarge  the number of cows. It will allow her to further develop her business.

Two years ago, Mamlekat’s elder son married and moved out. Using the revenues, Mamlekat plans to help her younger son, who lives with her, to buy a house in Kara-Balta town. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population.  Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie L. is from the village of La Victoria, Aurora,  Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 29 years old, married and has 1 infant. Rosie owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Rosie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Rosie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Rosie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: La Victoria, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en: Ludmila is married with one teenage son. She sells children's clothing at Ilona Market in Mukachevo town. She's been in this business for 16 years. Long experience and great optimism help Ludmila to maintain good sales. Moreover, children's clothing is always in demand. Ludmila would like to purchase more school clothing for sale. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 grivnas. Ludmila has good relationships with her colleagues at the market. They support and encourage one another to overcome difficult economic or personal challenges.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret N. is 42 years old and lives in the town of Kalisizo in the Masaka region of Uganda. She is married and has six children. All of her children are currently in school. Margret has a business in African arts and crafts, which she has had for less than one year.         

To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more materials for arts and crafts. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Margret hopes to generate greater profits and to pay school fees. In the future, Margret hopes to see her children complete university.

loans.use: To buy more materials for arts and crafts

loans.name: Sagynbubu's Group

texts.en:
Sagynbubu O. is the leader of the group. She is 52 years old and married. Both her husband and she are pensioners. Her family has 5 sons: the eldest one works in Moscow, the youngest is a student, and the rest are working in the capital of the country. Sagynbubu has her own business which includes selling national wares. Her earnings made it possible to arrange her son’s wedding. She needs to get a loan in order to purchase fabric and materials (50 meters) for sewing national wares. In the future Sagynbubu is planning to purchase sewing machines and to open her own sewing shop. 

Toktobubu J. is 54 and married. She has 2 children (a daughter and a son). All of her family members are engaged in their own jobs: the head of the family is a farmer, the daughter is married and sews national wares, the son breeds cattle, and the mother sells sewing stuff, coats, costumes and national wares. From their profits the family has managed to arrange their son’s wedding. The purpose of this loan is to increase commodity circulation. 

Emilbek T. is 48 and married. His wife sews national wares. The couple has 5 children (4 sons and a daughter). The eldest son raises money by working at a building site in Bishkek, the daughter works in confectioner’s shop, the youngest one is a toddler, and the rest are schoolboys. The family is also engaged in cattle breeding. Out of their earnings, they have managed to build a temporary construction and make repairs to it. The purpose of the loan is to purchase more cattle. In the future Emilbek wants to give a proper education to his children.

Talantbek B. is 38 and married. His wife is a farmer. The couple brings up 2 preschool aged children. Their main source of income is from cattle breeding, which they started 2 years ago after a loan was received. Talantbek wants to use a loan to increase commodity circulation. In the future he is planning to increase cattle stock.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase fabric and materials to make national wares

loans.name: Edwin Kiplagat

texts.en:
Edwin is forty-five years old, married to Ann M., and they have been blessed with three children aged 17, 15 and 11 years respectively. Edwin has been in the business of buying and selling cows for the last two years and from his income, he has been able to bring up his children and even send them to good schools.

He joined Kadet after he was introduced by an existing member. With this loan he plans to buy more cows and then sell them at a profit at the nearby centre where he has been operating. He is well known at the centre and he gets many calls from customers who are willing to buy from him or to sell him cows.

His future plan is to buy a plot at the centre and develop it in order to enable him to earn a living and educate all his children.

loans.use: To buy more cattle for resale

loans.name: Hillary

texts.en:
Twenty-eight years old Hillary is a married father of one child who is 4 months old. He is a dairy farmer from Litein town in the Rift Valley, Kenya. He sells his milk to the local hotels in Litein town. He also earns income from his small-scale farming of tea which he sells to a local tea factory. His biggest challenge has been the poor road network to the market.

He has requested this loan of 50,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a motorcycle for transporting milk to the market. The income from this loan will enable him meet the needs of his family. In future, he would like to expand his dairy farming and purchase a lorry for transporting milk to the market.

loans.use: To purchase a  motorcycle for transporting milk to the market.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita V. is from the village of Esperanza West. She is 52 years old. Nenita is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Nenita owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Nenita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nenita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nenita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Nenita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP that will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Nenita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “SR. DE TAYANCANI”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Ocongate perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Bertha; La socia es casada y tiene  6 hijos ella se dedica a la venta de comida de forma ambulatoria, la socia vende comiditas caseras como papas sancochadas con huevo sancochado y ají; nabo picado con choclo (maíz dulce) llamado nabojaucha, nombre en quechua. La socia lleva en ollitas envueltas en mantas gruesas para mantener el calor de sus platos y vende por porciones en la esquina de la plaza del pueblo. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos para elaborar sus comiditas.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su cuota en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Bertha is a member of the Communal Bank “Sr. De Tayancani”, which is located in the District of Ocongate, Quispicanchis Province, Department of Cusco.

She is married and has six children. Bertha sells food as a street vendor. She offers small meals such as boiled potatoes with eggs and peppers; and a dish called “nabojaucha” in Quechua that consists of chopped turnip greens and sweet corn. Bertha covers her pots in thick blankets to keep her dishes warm and then sell her meals from the corner of the city plaza. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of supplies for preparing food.

Bertha is grateful and values the loan that has been provided to her. Therefore, she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for preparing the food that she sells

loans.name: Mirian

texts.es: El señora Mirian dedicada a la venta de animales y leche que producen sus vacas esta actividad lo realiza durante toda la semana  siendo este trabajo bastante sacrificado ya que debe de ordeñar la leche desde muy tempranas horas y lleva sus animalitos a la venta los días de feria es así como la señora y su esposo trabajan juntos para poder mantener su familia, este crédito desean para comprar chachos y comercializarlos a fin de año ya que para estas época de año nuevo se acostumbra a comer lechón al horno ya que dice que es de buena suerte para iniciar el año, es una persona muy trabajadora y esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mirian's business is selling animals and also the milk that her cows produce.  She does this work all week.  The work demands quite a lot of sacrifice as she must milk her cows very early in the morning and take her animals to market on market days.  Mirian and her husband work together to support their family.

Mirian would like this loan to buy pigs that she can sell at the end of the year since, during the new year period, it is traditional to eat roasted suckling pig.  This is considered to bring good luck for the new year.  Mirian is a very hard-working person and she is grateful to the institution for the support she is receiving.

loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: Bazarhan

texts.en:
Bazarhan T. is 40 years old.  He lives with his wife and three children in Hovd province in Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent, on a  fenced lot. His three children all attend a local secondary school. His wife operates a vegetable growing business in her town. 

Bazarhan operates a transportation business in town using his own mini truck. He started this transportation service in 2008.  He has had much success and has earned significant experience as a driver. In addition, he operates meat trading business during the autum months to supplement his earnings. He purchases livestock from herders and slaughter them to sell the meat at the local market. 

For the future, Bazarhan hopes to continue making progress with his business.  He says, "I do everything that can earn money."  He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more livestock to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more livestock to sell

loans.name: Pensando En El Futuro 1-3 Group

texts.en:
This is a group of fifteen members called Pensando en el Futuro 1-3 (Thinking about the Future). All of the people in this group are trying to increase their small businesses and improve their lives. Sonia is the group representative. She is an extremely hard-working woman, with three children. She is a single mother. She is dedicated to her work because it enables her to support her family.

She has a small nail salon where she does artificial nails, manicures, and pedicures. Sonia is requesting her third loan, which she believes will really increase her income. She wants to reinvest almost all of her profits so that she can turn her small nail salon into a larger beauty salon. She dreams of having her own house and sending her children to college.

This Esperanza associate began with Esperanza as she was learning how to work with artificial nails and how to paint artistic designs on them. She needed capital to start her business. Her story is representative of her group and, generally, of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in Samana, a lush rugged peninsula with a growing tourism industry. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for nail salon

loans.name: Sao

texts.en:
Sao N. was born in 1963. She is a married woman and a good mother who is blessed with four children who are single. Two of her children are employed as overseas workers. To earn a living, Sao N. cultivates rice with her husband. 

Sao N. needs people to help with her farming business. She is requesting a loan from Kiva to hire domestic laborers to work with her to harvest her rice crop.

loans.use: to hire harvest laborers

loans.name: Fatima's Group

texts.en:
Fatima is a housewife who stays at home and does household work. She is a very responsible person who does her work with a sense of responsibility and effort.
 
Her husband’s name is B. A., and he has a milk- and yogurt-selling business. He operates his shop in the market, and people like buying from him due to his good quality products and services. He also has a second business selling goats to butchers after raising them up. For this purpose, he has six goats at home. 

Fatima has given birth to three sons and three daughters. All of them attend school, except the youngest son, who is only three years old.
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy more milk and prepare more yogurt from it to sell.
  
She is confident that, by using his 20 years of experience in his business, he will successfully be able to improve his sales and earnings. This is Fatima’s third loan application. She has always paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting. She lives in Samundri, which is a small city located in Punjab Province of Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She owns a three-room brick house there and has been living in it with her family for many years.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Fatima.

loans.use: To buy milk for milk- and yogurt-selling business

loans.name: William

texts.en: R. is currently in a business of selling bed/pillow cases. She is 48 years old, divorced, with 7 children and 5 of them go to school. R. borrowed a loan to stock more bed/pillow cases to sell. In the future, she hopes to pay for her children's schooling with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: To stock more bed/pillow cases to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formó gracias a la señora Carmen Elizabeth C., ella es una señora muy amable y activa, vive en su casita con sus tres hijos, ella es madre soltera pero siempre supo salir adelante a pesar de todo, ella tiene una despensa y retiró el crédito para poder agrandar su negocio ya que eso la ayudaría bastante.
También sus hijos tienen sus actividades para ayudarle en la economía del hogar.
La señora Carmen se enteró por medio de otros grupos que existe este programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y le interesó bastante, ella recorrió casa por casa en su barrio para conformar el grupo.
Este es un grupo muy unido, decidieron realizar actividades cada semana para obtener su caja en común, a pesar de que todas ellas tienen su micro-empresa.
Ellas son del Barrio Ypati de la Ciudad de Villa Elisa, sus metas son sacar siempre adelante al grupo, sus micro-empresas y también a sus familias, y todas dan gracias a la Fundación Paraguaya por la oportunidad que les da.
texts.en:
This committee was formed by Carmen Elizabeth C..  Carmen is a very kind and active lady who lives in her small home with her three children.  She is a single mother but has always known how to get ahead in life in spite of everything.  Carmen owns a grocery store and she took out this loan so that she could expand her business since this would help her a lot.  Carmen's children also have their own business activities and help her with the household finances.  

Carmen found out about the 'Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras' (Committee of Enterprising Women) program through other groups and she was very interested.  She went door to door in her neighborhood in order to get a group together.  This is a very united group whose members decided to carry out activities every week in order to make money for their joint fund, in spite of the fact that they all have their own small businesses to run.  The women are all from Ypati neighborhood, in the city of Villa Elisa.  Their goals are to always get their group, their small businesses and their families ahead.  They all give thanks to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity the organization gives them.

loans.use: to increase the size of her business

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.es:
La señora Virgilia Hernández V., es de un lugar llamado ocotepec, ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos a su responsabilidad y son: Braulia, Raquel, Clementino, Elizabeth,  y la más pequeña es Érika   de cinco años.

        Ella invirtió el préstamo en la compra de mercancía para surtir su tienda abarrotes, y solicito el préstamo para poder obtener los productos,  ya que por falta de recursos le hacen falta comprar más cosas, así tener  más clientela y mejor sea sus ingresos para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

      En esta actividad lleva cinco años y comenta que decidió ponerla para apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos de su hogar y así juntos logren salir adelante.
   
       Lo que más desea es que sus actividad crezca para poder tener más ingresos  así apoyar a su hijos que está estudiando  y logren tener una profesión.
texts.en:
Mrs. Virgilia H. V. is from a place called Ocotepec.  She is married and has 5 children in her care: Braulia, Raquel, Clementino, Elizabeth and the smallest, 5 years old, is Erika.

She invested the loan in the purchase of merchandise to stock her grocery store, and asked for the loan to be able to get the products. She has lacked resources to buy more and therefore increase her clientele and her income to improve her quality of life. 

She has been doing this for 5 years and says that she decided to open the store to help her husband with the house income, so that together they will be able to get ahead.  

Her greatest wish is that her business grows so that she can have more income and support her children who are studying so that they can become professionals.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like sugar, beans, oil, and cookies to stock her grocery store

loans.name: Kristi Colleen

texts.en:
Kristi Colleen works hard to support her family. She is married and has an internet cafe in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional computers for her business. She has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Kristi Colleen would like to develop and expand her business and save enough money to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional computers for her business.

loans.name: Batbayar

texts.en:
Batbayar is 35 years old and lives with his wife and two children, aged 1 and 3, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a ger, Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent, in his parent's backyard. He manages a fruit and sweet-stuff trading business with the help of his wife. 

Batbayar started his business in 2008 at a rented stall at Narantuul market, one of the crowded and busiest markets in Ulaanbaatar city. Since then, his business has become quite profitable which has allowed him to buy a car. Now, his monthly sales have reached to 200,000 MNT, with daily earning of 70,000 MNT. In addition to his fruit-trading business, he began to operate a taxi service in order to add to his family's earnings. He is planning to expand his business in the future. He is a hardworking man who says, "I am saving my earnings in order to renew my car in the near future." He is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase a variety of fruit at wholesale prices.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of fruit at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Aline

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits de nécessités (riz, sardine,….) depuis 1997, Aline est mariée et mère de deux enfants.ses provisions se font au Grant marché de Lomé et la revente dans un autre marché de la capitale. Ce pret lui servira à acheter des produits de premieres nécessités(riz, huile végétale, sucre...) pour avoir plus de benefices et agrandir son activité.
texts.en: Aline is married and the mother of two children.  She has been selling staple items (rice, sardines, etc.) since 1997.  She obtains her supplies at Lomé’s Grand Market and sells them in another market in the capital.  This loan will enable her to buy staple products (rice, vegetable oil, sugar, etc.) in order to increase her profit and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy staple items

loans.name: Lola

texts.es: Lola, de 48 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Cesar de 48 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Yasmin de 17 y Noelia de 14 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Trabajando todos los días arduamente en sus cultivos de palma, Lola trata de cambiar la vida que actualmente lleva, poniendo todo su esfuerzo. Siembra continuamente las palmas que le dan el aceite que vende a una empresa de la ciudad de Pucallpa, ya que es ahí donde mejores precios obtiene. Tiene 4 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar su siembra de la plaga de insectos, asimismo el tener que llevar el aceite le resulta muy complicado por lo pesado que es. En adelante, espera mejorar su producción y así obtener mejores precios, por ello pide de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus objetivos. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, siente que este crédito le será muy beneficioso en su crecimiento como agricultora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y solidaria. Con los mil doscientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más sacos de abono para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en: Lola is 48 years old she is a very kind and hardworking woman. She lives in her own home with her husband, Cesar who is 48 years old, and their 2 loving children, Yasmin 17 and Noelia 14 years old, to whom they want to give the best quality of life. She works hard everyday on her palm crops. Lola is trying hard to change the life that she currently lives by giving her all.
