She continuously sows her palms that give her oil that she sells to a company in the city of Pucuallpa since she receives the best prices there. Lola has been working in this field for 4 years and what she enjoys most is taking care of her crops from insects pests. What she enjoys least is taking the oil since it is really heavy. In the future, Lola would like to improve her production to have better prices which is why she is asking for your help to be able to meet her goals. This is her fourth loan with MFP and feels that this loan will be very helpful as she continues to grow as a farmer. In her communal bank, Lola is an active and supportive member. With the twelve hundred nuevos soles she will buy more sacks of manure to improve her crops.

loans.use: buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
61-year-old Erlinda is a farmer who lives in the town of Banga, South Cotabato with her family. She primarily grows rice to sell. She also has coconut trees planted on part of her land. Erlinda also owns and manages a small sari-sari store. She sells various items like noodles, vinegar and other food products and personal care items.

Erlinda's loan will be used to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs. She hopes to have a stable income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Thou

texts.en: Thou sells a few wares in front of her home. She sells items like soft drink, sweets for children, and some cooking supplies. To meet the family’s living expenses, her husband has good skills for building stone and wooden houses. This couple has five children, one is single, four are married. Three of their children are employed in different occupations. Recently, Thou’s items for sale have been exhausted; she wants to resupply and is requesting a loan to increase her stock inventory of soft drink, sweets, cooking supplies, etc. so she can continue selling.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of soft drink, sweets, cooking supplies, etc. so she can continue selling.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 46 years old and lives in Kakata, a town to the north of Monrovia. She is married and her husband grows and sells rubber. Evelyn has four children aged between 15 and 19, all of whom live at home and go to school. She attended school herself reaching ninth grade.
Evelyn has a small business selling rice, biscuits and other dried goods from a table in the market. She has run this business for eight years, and it is going well for her and she has lots of customers. She started the business with money from her own savings. Evelyn will use this loan to purchase more stock for the business and to help with school fees. In the future, she hopes to improve her standard of living and lead a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for the business.

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer is 37 years old, married and has nine children. For the past sixteen years she has run a sari-sari store in the Philippines, working hard to provide for her family. She also earns an income from buying and selling tobacco.

Jenifer has requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock such as noodles, canned goods and shampoo to sell in her sari-sari store.

Jenifer has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She wants to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Rubi

texts.es: Rubí es una gran vendedora tiene 23 años de edad, soltera y pese a su corta edad es una mujer muy trabajadora ella se dedica a vender ropa para dama y niños también vende ropa interior, tiene con este negocio mas de 6 años y surte su ropa en la cuidad de Moroleón Guanajuato ella esta pidiendo un crédito por que quiere comprar trajes de pants para dama y caballero y comprar algo de uniformes ya que se viene la temporada de venta de los uniformes para el nuevo ciclo escolar, también comprara calcetas para las niñas de las escuelas y ropa interior para niños. Esta muy entusiasmada con la financiera por que dice que le han hablado muy bien de esta y lo que más le llamo la atención es que les ayuda a salir adelante con sus negocios. La meta que tiene Rubí es poner un negocio especialmente para su ropa ya que la tiene en la sala de su casa y ella quisiera un local estable.
texts.en:
Rubi is a great saleswoman.  She is 23 years old, single, and, in spite of her young age, is a very hard-working woman.  She sells clothes for women and children and also underwear.  She has worked in this business for more than 6 years and takes her clothes to the city of Moroleón, Guanajuato.
She is asking for a loan because she wants to buy pant suits for women and men and uniforms, now that the season to sell uniforms for the new school year is coming.  She will also buy stockings for schoolgirls and underwear for boys.  
She is very enthusiastic about the financial organization because she says people have spoken very highly of it.  What most caught her attention is that it helps people move forward with their businesses.  Rubi’s goal is to start a business especially for clothing, since she currently runs her business out of her living room, and would like to have a more stable location.

loans.use: to sell clothes.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is 26 years old and single. He is a hardworking businessman. For the last 2 years, Eric has been running an electronics shop and a hardware store. He employs two people in his business. Over the next 5 years, Eric wants to have increased his product portfolio. His dream is to expand his business.

Eric is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy a television. Thanks to Faulu Kenya he has been able to access finances to inject into his business.

loans.use: To buy a television

loans.name: Flores De Pascua Group

texts.es:
Sra. Hilda   cuenta con 43 años de edad es casada con 7 hijos los cuales 4 depende de ella. Sus hijos estudian, Sandy lu estudia la secundaria y óscar y Antonio estudia la primaria, su esposo se llama Sergio él se dedica al campo. Ella  se dedica al comercio  vende ropa sale a los pueblos a vender  ella invirtió su préstamo en comprar más ropa para vender.
Ella tiene una meta la cual es arreglar un local y establecer una tienda de ropa en su casa, ya que quiere hacer crecer su negocio da las gracias al préstamo ya que le ayudo mucho en su negocio.
Sra. Hilda pertenece al grupo flores de pascua le pusieron ese nombre ya que el grupo esta integrado por puras mujeres, el cual está integrado por  10 miembros, hay 9 miembros más que a continuación son mencionados:
1.	Sra. Romalda quien tiene una zapatería y invirtió su préstamo en surtir nuevos modelos de zapatos, 2. Sra., Verónica quien tiene una dulcería y invirtió su préstamo en surtir más dulces, 3. Sra. María Félix tiene un pequeño negocio de dulces, 4.Sra. Nely tiene un pequeño negocio de refrescos y invirtió su préstamo en comprar más refrescos, 5. Sra. Elia tiene un negocio de verduras y invirtió su préstamo en la compra de verduras, 6. Sra. Adelfa tiene un negocio de refrescos y invirtió su préstamo en la compra de mas refrescos, 7. Sra. Reyna productos de campos como maíz, calabaza, sandia, etc. Invirtió su préstamo en herramientas para trabajar en el campo, 8. Sra. Epifanía ella vende tamales y atoles y lo invirtió en los insumos que utiliza para hacer sus tamales y su atole, 9. Sra. Fabiola tiene un negocio de verdura invirtió su prestamos en comprar más verduras.
texts.en:
Señora Hilda is 43, is married, and has 4 children, 4 of whom are still her dependents.  Her children go to school.  Her daughter, Sandy Lu, is in secondary school.  Her son, Antonio, is in elementary school.  Her husband's name is Sergio, and he works in the field.  She sells clothing and goes to various towns to sell it.  She invested her loan in buying more clothing to sell.

She has a goal, which is to fix up a location and to establish a clothing store in her house.  She wants to make her business grow, and she is thankful for this loan because it has helped her a lot in her business.

Hilda belongs to the communal bank, "Flores de Pascua," (Easter Flowers).  They named their group this because all of the members are women.  There are 10 members, and 9 are mentioned below:

1. Romalda has a shoe store and invested her loans in new styles of shoes.
2. Verónica has a candy store and invested her loan in more candy.
3. María Félix has a small candy store.
4. Nely has a small soft drink business and invested her loan in more drinks.
5. Elia has a vegetable business and invested her loan in the purchase of vegetables.
6. Adelfa has a soft drink business and invested her loan in more drinks.
7. Reyna sells agricultural products like corn, squash, watermelons, etc.  She invested her loan in tools to work in the field.
8. Epifanía sells tamales and "atoles" (hot corn drinks).  She invested her loan in supplies to make her tamales and atoles.
9. Fabiola has a vegetable business and invested her loan in the purchase of more vegetables.

loans.use: to invest in buying more clothing

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong is 43 years old and is the mother of two children. She is married and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a worker in a local factory. 

Hong runs a food stall, which she has been operating for over 10 years. She sell meals, breads and beverages for breakfast and lunch. 

Hong is requesting a loan to buy new furniture for her stall and purchase more types of food to sell. She hopes that will help her earn more money so she can reinvest in her current business and save enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: To purchase new furniture and more types of food to sell.

loans.name: Flame Lily Group

texts.en: Rebecca is 60 years old and lives in Gweru. She is a widow. She has two adult children. Rebecca rears and sells chickens. The main problems she faces are sourcing feeds and medicines. She will spend the money she borrows to address these needs and to purchase more day-old chicks. She will also use the money she borrows to upgrade her rural home. She hopes, in time, to have eight fowl runs and four batches of 1,000 hens each.

loans.use: to buy chicks, feed and medicines

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Amani from Bani Kenanah, Irbid, Jordan is a 30-year-old woman who has her own grocery store. Amani is requesting a loan of 800 JD  to expand her store and purchase more new products to sell.

Amani started her business years ago from home. Then with her exceptional hard work, she turned it into an established store near her home.

Amani's aspiration is to increase her sales volume and improve her family's living conditions.

Due to cultural issues, Amani refused to use her photo publicly so the man in the picture is her brother.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Mariela Colombia

texts.es:
Mariela Colombia tiene trentaiun años de edad es casada tiene dos hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de diez y siete años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

LA VRC NUEVA UNIÓN, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Guamayacu, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandía, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul.

Mariela se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul las compras y las ventas las realiza Echeandia. 

Con el dinero  del prestamo anterior pudo comprar semillas e insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.
En la familia la relación ha mejorado porque ahora puede aportar un poco más para el bienestar de la familia, en el trabajo le va mucho mejor porque a aumentado la producción en los ingresos a mejorado mucho porque ahora con la venta de los productos obtiene más ingresos. Con el apoyo de anterior crédito le ha ayudado a superarse y no tuvo ningún problema para poder cancelar las cuotas establecidas por la cooperativa. 

Este nuevo Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque le servirá para comprar semillas, plantas de cacao e insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.

Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes son: la competencia y las plagas. El sueño es seguir trabajando para poder adquirir y ser dueño de una finca.En los tiempos libres le gusta practicar los deportes, compartir con la familia, hacer mingas familiares.

"Esta muy agradecido por la ayuda brindada".
texts.en:
Mariela Colombia is 31 years old.  She is married and has two children, ages ten and seven.  They live in Ventanas canton, Los Ríos province. 

The Nueva Unión Communal Bank is located in the Guamayacu precinct, in Echeandia canton. The members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice, kidney beans, and pigeon peas.  Mariela makes her living in agriculture, growing corn, rice, kidney beans, and pigeon peas.  She makes purchases and sells her products in Echeandia.  

With the money from the previous loan, she was able to purchase seeds and agricultural supplies such as urea, Matamonte herbicide, fertilizer, and weed killer to maintain healthy crops.  

Her family relationships have improved because now she can contribute a little more toward the family’s well-being.  Her work is going much better for her because production has increased and she earns more income from the sale of her products.  The support of the previous loan has helped her to succeed and she never had any problem meeting the payment terms established by the cooperative.

This new loan will be a big help because it will enable her to purchase seeds, cacao plants, and agricultural supplies such as urea, Matamonte herbicide, fertilizer, and weed killer to maintain healthy crops. 

The most frequent challenges she faces are competition and blight.   Her dream is to continue working so that she can purchase her own farm.  In her free time, she enjoys playing sports, spending time with her family, and participating in “mingas” (cooperative community projects).  

“She is very grateful for the help being offered.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, cacao plants and agricultural supplies such as urea, fertilizer, Matamonte herbicide, and weed killer to maintain healthy crops.

loans.name: Madin

texts.en: Madin is a 30-year-old Lebanese single man living with one parent and two siblings. Madin supports his family financially and does not hesitate to give them help whenever they need it. He has been involved in agriculture for the past eight years. In 2006, he started to work independently on his own land growing vegetables. Today, he’s requesting a loan of $800 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l, to purchase agriculturA. supplies. In the future, he plans to expand his business and he is very confident that he will be able to achieve substantiA. growth in the coming season.

loans.use: to purchase needed agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Casilda

texts.es: La señora Casilda esta casada y tiene dos hijos pequeños, vive en casa de su suegro, ella se dedica a la confección de blusas para cholitas en su domicilio, la venta lo realiza en la ciudad de Cochabamba los días de feria  como son miércoles y sábados, entregando al por mayor a diferentes puestos del mercado pero también vende por menor, ella es una persona joven y emprendedora con ganas de salir adelante, su sueño es el de poder tener un taller mas grande y poder confecciona una gran cantidad de blusas y poder venderlas en la ciudad de Oruro y Potosí, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de tela para confección de blusas ya estas fechas de fin de año tiene mucha demanda.
texts.en: Casilda is married and has two small children. She lives in her father-in-law’s house. She sews blouses in her home for women who wear traditional dress. She makes her sales in the city of Cochabamba on market days, like Wednesday and Saturday, by turning in whole-sale orders to different market stalls, but she also sells items individually. She is a young and enterprising person with a desire to get ahead. Her dream is to have a larger workshop and to be able to sew a large number of blouses and sell them in the city of Oruro y Potosí. She will use the money from the loan to buy fabric for blouses. There is a lot of demand at this time of year, at the end of the year.

loans.use: to buy fabric for sewing blouses

loans.name: Lily Tabanas 's Group

texts.en: Lily is a 58-year-old widow with five children. She lives in the Philippines and earns a living by growing corn. She has been in this line of work for 10 years and is applying for a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy fertilizer for her farm. She has been a member of PMPC for many years and hopes to set aside enough money to deal with future emergencies. She leads a two-person loan group.  Although the members borrow as a group, each has her own business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm.

location.town: Ozamis-Sangay Daku, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Alba Lucia

texts.es: Alba  de 54 años, vive en la ciudadela 20 de Julio con su familia conformada por su esposo, quien es comerciante de artículos de cacharrería puerta a puerta, y sus 5 hijos que ya son mayores de edad.  Allí Vende papelería, productos de aseo, detalles de ocasión, y  variedades en general además de gaseosas, pasabocas, mecatos.  Sus clientes son los vecinos del sector y transeúntes del barrio, sus ventas son de contado, así como también sus compras que las realiza en el centro de la ciudad de Barranquilla. Este negocio es atendido por la empresaria y una de sus hijas y lo inició desde el año 2003, como parte de la experiencia tradicional de su familia paterna, núcleo en el cual todos son comerciantes.   Sus principales clientes son los vecinos del barrio y de otros aledaños, peatones que transitan el sector. Aunque la competencia es alta,  Alba Luz se sostiene con un buen servicio, respondiendo a las necesidades de su clientela y con precios competitivos. En la actualidad tiene su sueño de crecimiento empresarial y considera que esta es una de las mejores épocas para invertirle a su negocio capital de crédito, como al que está aplicando en la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, porque tradicionalmente conoce que es la temporada en la cual incrementa sus ventas de contado y rota rápidamente su capital de trabajo. Con su credikiva, primer financiamiento,   comprará artículos alusivos a la navidad, juguetes, accesorios femeninos  y ropa elegante, sobre pedidos que ya hicieron sus clientes, lo cual garantiza que su inventario rote muy rápido, y también la ampliación de su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Alba is 54 years old and lives in the July 20th neighborhood with her family which consists of her husband, a merchant who sells housewares door-to-door, and their five grown children. She manages a store where she sells stationery, toiletries, seasonal gifts, and a variety of other products such as sodas, snacks, and packaged lunches. Her customers include her neighbors and people who pass through the area. She sells on a cash basis. Alba purchases her merchandise in the central part of the city of Barranquilla.

She has been managing this business with one of her daughters since 2003. Alba is continuing a tradition since everyone on her father’s side of the family was in the retail trade. Her primary customers are residents of the neighborhood and from the surrounding areas. She also serves pedestrians who visit the neighborhood. Although the level of competition is high, Alba Luz is able to maintain good service. She responds to the needs of her customers and offers competitive prices. At the moment, she dreams of growing as an entrepreneur and considers this moment to be one of the best times to invest in a loan for her business.

Alba is submitting a request to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo because she knows this season is traditionally the time when her cash sales increase and her inventory has rapid turnover. With this Kiva loan, her first form of financing, she will buy items for Christmas such as toys, women’s accessories, and formal clothing. Her customers have already placed their orders, so Alba is guaranteed of very quick turnover and the need to increase her operating capital.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for Christmas such as toys, women’s accessories, and formal clothing.

loans.name: Santa Cruz - Concepcion Group

texts.es:
La Señora. JESSI AYDEE de 31 años de edad madre soltera con 02  hijo el  menor de edad  de 11 años en etapa escolar, mujer Profesional luchadora  con los ánimos de salir adelante.  Es socias de la  alcancía comunal “Santa  Cruz - Concepción”.
Actualmente se dedica a la venta de materiales de construcción que vende tuberías, fierros, cemento, clavos, etc. en una tienda alquilada. El préstamo solicito para la compra de materiales como  fierros, tubos polietilenos, accesorios, motor, etc. Así pueda invertir en su negocio y ahorrar. Desea en el futuro comprar su camioneta para trasladar sus materiales de negocio. 
La Sra. JESSI AYDEE chompa color blanco y un pantalón color negro es la primera persona  lado derecha de la fotografía a lado de la señora que viste con chompa color  rojo.
La personas de parte superior de la fotografía es la Sra. Alina Martha quien no pudo participar en la reunión por motivo de trabajo.
texts.en:
Jessi Aydee, age 31, is a single mother of two. Her youngest child is 11; school-aged. Jessi Aydee is a professional, hard-working woman with a desire to get ahead. She is a member of the Santa  Cruz - Concepción communal bank.
She sells construction supplies in a store which she rents. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of supplies such as tools, polyethylene tubes, accessories, etc. With this loan, she will be able to invest in her business and save. In the future she wants to buy a truck to transport her merchandise. She is the first person on the right, wearing the white sweater.The person in the upper photo is Sra. Alina Martha, who could not be present for the meeting because of work obligations.

loans.use: with her hardware store, selling construction supplies.

loans.name: Hun

texts.en:
Hun, 55, is married and resides in Kampong Chnang Province. Hun buys rice in bulk to resell when the price is profitable, and her husband sells palm juice. 

Hun is requesting a loan of US $900 to purchase more rice to stock for resale. 

In the future, Hun would like to send her children to study Korean so that they can go to work in South Korea. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more rice to stock for resale.

loans.name: Juan Angel

texts.es: Juan, de nuevo solicita otro préstamo porque quiere comprar tres  cerdos para engordarlos y luego venderlos al mercado y de ese modo mejorar en sus ingresos. Con el préstamo anterior le ayudo porque obtuvo buenas cosechas de maíz y frijol para el consumo de su familia y una parte para venderlo de esa forma pudo ayudar a su familia en la alimentación y actualmente esta estable.
texts.en: Juan applies again for a loan because he wants to buy three pigs to fatten, sell them at the market and thus improve his income. The previous loan helped him to get a good crop of corn and beans for family consumption and sale, which helped him to provide his family with food and stability.

loans.use: to buy three pigs.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 35-year-old married man who has operated a retail business for a period of 3 years now. He started with money he got from brick selling, a business he operated first. He faces the problems of price fluctuation and inadequate capital. He would like to build a permanent house, educate his children and diversify his business into other markets. Joseph needs the loan facility to buy cooking oil, sodas, beers and beans for resale.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, sodas, beers and beans for resale.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Hello Kiva Lenders!Meet Eunice a 62 year old smallholder farmer from the Kapsowar area of Kenya an area known for producing the "cream dela cream" in the athletics field.She has been farming for the past ten years and her primary sources of income have been maize and some personal business or side hustle that she does to supplement her meager income.She is happily married to a handsome hubby by the name of Joshua and they are blessed with seven cute looking children who are her greatest motivation in life to persevere.Eunice is kindly seeking a loan of KES 80,000 to buy seeds and start horticulture farming.The Kapsowar area has favourable conditions that support horticulture farming that is good roads,climate and a ready market for horticulture products.Through the loan Eunice will be able to meet the demand of horticulture products that is in her village.
Her future projections are that by the end of the first harvest she will be able to sell to other markets far from her remote village.Be inspired during this festive season and support a Kenyan woman smallholder farmer with a loan!

loans.use: To buy seeds and start horticulture farming

loans.name: Ziburaikarire Silc Group

texts.en: Udita is a single woman with 3 children who lives in Kyenjojo Uganda. She sells sodas, spirits, beers, cooking oil, salt and soap. She obtains additional income from a pork joint business. Her vision is to look after her children but experiences low turn up of customers, bad debts and her vision is to be economically okay using the proceeds from her business. Udita needs the loan to buy spirits, soda and beer to sell. She is a member of Ziburaikarire Silc Group where members guarantee one another for a loan.

loans.use: to buy spirits, soda and beer to sell

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ms. Ama D. is a married mother of four children. Her husband works primarily as a fisherman, but his income in insufficient to pay all of the family’s expenses. This situation requires Ms. Ama D. to work hard to contribute a large part of the family’s income. She has already obtained a loan of $400 to build her business of selling cosmetic products, which she has been running for six years. Her energy and her ability to manage a loan have earned her the reputation of a model woman in her town. Faced with new responsibilities in paying household expenses, she is seeking to improve her business but does not have the means to do so. She is requesting a loan of $600, which will help her to buy, stock and resell cosmetic products. The success of this project will allow her to improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame D. Ama est une femme mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants. L’activité principale de son mari est la pêche artisanale dont le rendement est insuffisant pour couvrir la totalité des frais liés à la gestion des charges de la famille. Cette situation obligea Madame D. Ama à travailler ardemment pour contribuer dans une large mesure aux charges du ménage. Elle a obtenu un crédit de $400 pour renforcer son commerce de produits de beauté qu’elle exerce il y a 6 ans. Son dynamisme et son aptitude à gérer un crédit lui confèrent une place de femme modèle dans la localité. Face à sa nouvelle responsabilité dans son ménage, elle cherche à améliorer son commerce mais ne dispose pas assez de moyens. Elle sollicite un de $600 qui va servir à acquérir, à stocker et à revendre les produits de beauté. La réalisation de ce projet lui permettra d’améliorer le niveau de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy and sell cosmetic products

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.en: I work selling homemade meals since I have two school-age children. Thus, I need the help of new funds to stock my inventory and improve sales.

loans.use: Purchase of tortillas, frijoles, bananas, eggs, cheese, meat, etc.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
My name is María R. and I make a living selling groceries like beans, corn, sugar, rice, lard, oil and other such products. I have had my business for the past two years and my son helps me packaging the products, since I buy in large quantities and have to re-package them into one pound bags to be able to sell the products. My goal is to increase my product stock and with the earnings be able to remodel my grocery store and feed my family.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Maite Barragán

Mi nombre es Maria R. me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular como ser frijoles, maiz, azucar, arroz, manteca, aceite, tengo mi negocio hace unos 2 años, tengo la ayuda de mi hijo para el empacado de mi producto ya que los frijoles, arroz, sal, azucar la compro por quintales y tengo que empacarlo en libras para poder venderlos, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi pulperia y tambien alimentar mi familia.

loans.use: purchasing basic grains, lard, oil, sugar, salt, bags

loans.name: Ruphina

texts.en:
Born in 1962, Rophina S. is married and is a mother of four children, two daughters and two sons. Education for her four children, both in the formal and informal sector, is her primary drive.  She used to borrow from neighbors at a very high interest rate before she received her first loan of $30 from GHAPE, which she invested in crop cultivation.  GHAPE also trained her in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline, which has been reinforced by bi-monthly meetings. 

Given a loan of $1200, she plans to open a first aid store.  This will help her raise money to pay for school fees for her children and younger siblings. Her community stands to benefit from the supply of drugs.  She plans to repay her loan in 24 months.  Her first loan repayment installment  will be made four  months from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase drugs and to pay rent for the store

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh, 43-years old, married and mother of two children, runs a small shop in the little village of Deir Qanoun, close to the city of Tyre, South Lebanon. She produces traditional food and Lebanese mixtures of cooking spices that she sells in her neighborhood to women who neither have the skills nor the time to prepare these products. For example, Fatmeh prepares a large variety of jams, marmalades, pickles, tomato pasta, fresh dried herbs and spices, herbal tea, etc.

Fatmeh and her family live in an economically vulnerable situation: she is the sole breadwinner of the family as her physically disabled husband is not able to work and to generate an income. 

This is the second time Fatmeh requests a loan from Al Majmoua. She is requesting a loan for $400 to purchase new equipment and a stock of fresh spices. 

Fatmeh is part of a group loan with other women from the same village. A group is usually constituted of self-chosen women, living in vulnerable conditions, mostly in rural areas. The group lending is based on incremental increase of loan amount and group solidarity to guarantee repayment. The strength of the group loan is that it encourages the collaboration approach in the borrowing community. It is a very powerful tool towards economic empowerment of women.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment, like a small mixer, and a stock of fresh spices

loans.name: Sarita

texts.es:
Sarita is 45 years old, lives in the district of La Esperanza, in the province of Trujillo and region of La Libertad. She finished high school and has 3 children who are dependent on her.

She has a business in the Parque Industrial market, which is near the Manuel Arévalo development, in the district of La Esperanza. She sells chicken soup, patazca (a traditional Peruvian soup), drinks, newspapers, and gasoline. She started running a small store from her own house but she soon realized that she was capable of doing more. She was granted a loan from Manuela Ramos. She saw a store in the marketplace near her home and decided to buy it. This is how she started to her food business with a soup pot - this has led to increase in sales and menu variety.

Sarita has an account with Banco Comunal "Santa Elena" through a friend. She obtained her first loan of approximately 100 soles (Peruvian currency), which was used to buy soup pots and other cooking utensils. This last loan of 600 soles from Manuela Ramos will be paid off in 4 months. It will be used to purchase a sack of brown rice, carbonated beverages, beer, newspapers, gasoline. Sarita dreams of having a larger, more modern and established business and seeing her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Sarita tiene 45 años de edad, vive en el distrito de La Esperanza Provincia de Trujillo, Departamento de La Libertad. Estudió la secundaria completa; tiene 3 hijos los cuales aun dependen de ella.

Tiene su negocio en el mercado Parque Industrial ubicado en la urbanización Manuel Arévalo, Distrito de La Esperanza; vende caldo de gallina, caldo de cabeza, patazca, bebidas, periódicos y gas. Ella se inicia desde hace mucho con una pequeña bodega ubicada en su propia casa, pero se dio cuenta que podía hacer algo mas ya que ahora contaba con el préstamo que le había otorgado Manuela Ramos, así que ve un puesto en el mercado que esta cerca de su domicilio y decide comprarlo y es así como empieza el negocio de la venta de comida primero con una ollita de caldo y como veía que había venta fue aumentando y variando el menú.

La señora Sarita ingresa al Banco Comunal “Santa Elena” por medio de una amiga. Obtuvo su primer crédito de S/300.00 con los cuales compró ollas y otros utensilios para la preparación de los caldos. El reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.600.00, el cual cancelará en 4 meses, le servirá para comprar un saco de arroz, un saco de papas, gaseosas, cerveza, periódicos y gas. La señora Sarita sueña con un negocio más grande, moderno e implementado, y con ver a sus hijos profesionales.

loans.use: To buy kitchen supplies, newspapers, gas, etc.

loans.name: Atsoufui

texts.fr:
Miss Astoupi has been a hair salon owner for the past two years. She is 25 years old and learned this trade in the city education centre. With the help of her parents, she started her own hair salon in a roadside shack. She is asking for a loan so that she can improve her hair salon and attract more clients. She is a serious and very motivated woman.

Mlle Astoupi est propriétaire de coiffure depuis deux ans.Elle agée de 25 ans et a appris son métier dans l'un des centre de formation de la ville. Avec l'aide de ses parents elle a commencé sa coiffure dans une barraque au bord de la route . Elle veut que l'emprunt améliorer le cadre du sallon afin d'attirer plus de clientèle. C'est une fille sérieuse et pleine d'initiative

loans.use: Improvement of Hair Salon

loans.name: Kireku B Group

texts.en:
Jane is 42 years old and married with six children. She owns a retail shop and wants to use the extra profits to buy a fridge. Esther and Mastula sell charcoal and want to use the loan to purchase more sacks of charcoal. Racheal's current business is selling used clothes.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To increase stock and expand their businesses.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es:
Rosmery lives with her husband and children in her sister-in-law’s home, on Michel street in the Alto San Pedro zone of La Paz. She sells Avon cosmetic products and socks. She doesn’t have a store, but rather she sells on the street. Her husband works as a policeman in the American Embassy, but the wage is very low so she helps with her daily sales. She is asking for a loan to expand her business by buying other products and thereby be able to increase her income. Her previous credit history qualifies her as a good client and she can have a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora vive en casa de su cuñada, en el pasaje Michel de la zona de Alto San Pedro de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposo e hijos, se dedica a la venta de productos Avon (cosméticos) y calcetines. No tiene puesto fijo, deambula por la calle, el esposo trabaja como policía en la Embajada Americana, pero el sueldo es muy bajo por lo cual ella ayuda con sus ventas diarias. Solicita crédito para ampliar su negocio comprando otros productos y así poder mejorar sus ingresos. Su antecedente histórico lo califica como buen cliente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Buy products

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is Mariam N., who is married with four children, aged between 8 and 18.

Mariam owns a business selling fish and salt, and requests a loan of $275 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of fish and salt in bulk.

loans.name: Ruth Dilenia

texts.en: Ruth Dilenia is the proud mother of three children (two daughters and one son), two of whom attend school. Ruth Dilenia owns and operates a poultry shop, which she starts about five years ago with her husband’s help. She also operates a "pica pollo", a restaurant where people can buy deep-fried chicken with fried bananas or potatoes. She operates the "pica pollo" in the night. The entrepreneur explains that the local stall where she runs the business is not hers but a rented one. She plans to buy it in a few years. In the meantime, she says she’ll dedicate all her efforts to improve the quality of the services she’s offering to her clientele.  Ruth Dilenia wants a loan to purchase more chicken in order to increase her sales volume and her income.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase live chickens for a "pica pollo" and a poultry shop.

loans.name: Oscar Francisco

texts.es:
Don Oscar lives in the neighborhood of Casimiro Sotelo. He is 52 years old and is a telecommunications technician. He's focused on this carreer for 11 years. He's a widower and his daughter is currently attending school. His focus at this time is to have enough earnings in order to support his daughter with her education. He also wishes to have his own telecommunications business. He has been improving his home and with this latest loan, hopes to make sturdier wall divisions (they are currently made out of plastic).

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Oscar habita en el Barrio Casimiro Sotelo, con 52 años de edad es técnico en telecomunicaciones y tiene 11 años de estar en este oficio. Es viudo y tiene una hija que se encuentra estudiando. Su fijación en estos momentos es tener suficientes ingresos para apoyar al máximo a su hija en el periodo de educación, aunque también desea llegar algun dia a tener su propio negocio de telecomunicaciones. Ha ido mejorando su casa, y con este préstamo quiere cambiar las divisiones de su casa, las que actualmente son de plástico, y las quiere construir de concreto

loans.use: Make wall dividers to his home

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Pham Thi T., 50 years old, has 3 children, one of whom is grown-up, living separately and the other two are still living with her. When she first joined the TYM Fund, she borrowed 200 USD and invest in breeding pigs and small retail. Then, she started saving money and was able to open a small woodshop. Their hard work and clever hands earned them more income. Currently, her family income is 200 USD/month. She wants to borrow 550 USD to buy more wood and expand the workshop. She also will use a small amount from the borrowed money to invest in small retail.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Phạm Thị T. năm nay 50 tuổi. Gia đình chị có 3 người con đã trưởng thành, 1 con đã lập gia đình riêng , 2 con hiện đang sống cùng bố mẹ. Khi mới tham gia vào Quỹ Tình Thương chị vay 3.000.000đ để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và buôn bán nhỏ. Sau một thời gian tham gia vào Quỹ chị đã vay thêm vốn kết hợp với nguồn vốn tự có của gia đình, vợ chồng chị đã mở một xưởng mộc nhỏ để tạo công ăn việc làm cho các con. Nhờ chăm chỉ làm ăn, với tay nghề vững, chồng và các con chị luôn có việc làm thường xuyên vì thế ngoài thu nhập từ việc buôn bán cảu chị, gia đình chị đã có thêm nguồn thu ổn định từ xưởng mộc gia đình. Hiện nay thu nhập của gia đình chị đạt 3.000.000đ/ tháng Để mở rộng hoạt động của xưởng mộc, chị muốn vay thêm 9.000.000đ để mua thêm gỗ cho chồng và con đóng đồ dân dụng để bán. Chị cũng sẽ sử dụng một phần nhỏ trong vòng vốn tới để đầu tư thêm cho công việc buôn bán.

loans.use: woodshop and small retail

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria W. is a fishmonger. She is a single parent whose income is not sufficient for herself and her 2 children. Demand for her processed fish is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

Victoria is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Shouman

texts.en: S., a 48-years-old married man, lives with his wife and 2 children in Baalbek, located in the Bekaa valley. S. sells second-hand clothes. The loan he is requesting, USD 1200, will be used to purchase a wider variety of merchandise to diversify the selection he can offer to his clients. This is the first time S. has requested a loan from Al Majmoua; his background makes him a good candidate for a loan.

loans.use: Purchase a wider variety of merchandise

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana G. is a 34 year old woman. She is divorced due to marital problems, and she has two kids. Juliana is a very hard worker. She enjoys sales work and for the past two years her major source of livelihood has been cosmetic sales. Juliana says selling cosmetics is lucrative, and her experience in the market has enabled her to gain many loyal customers. She does not have a shop at the moment, so she sells on top of a table at the community market. She also sometimes travels from house to house to meet and deliver products to all of her customers.

With a loan, Juliana believes that she will have more resources to purchase additional stock of cosmetics and jewelry to increase her inventory and income. She is a member of Amazing Grace group. Members in this group provide assistance to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of cosmetic products.

loans.name: Kaday

texts.en: This is Kaday K.. Kaday is 42 years old. Depending on the season, Kaday sells jeans, ground-nuts, beans, palm-oil, etc. Kaday is married to a business man who sells "gari" (food made out of the cassavas plant) and palm-oil.  They have seven children – one is in college, four are in secondary school, one is in primary school and the other is a motor mechanic. This is the first time Kaday is seeking a loan from SMT. She is requesting a loan of Le 5,000,000.00.  She will use the proceeds from the loan to buy more ground-nuts, beans and rice to sell in the marketplace. She will use the profits to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: Kaday would like to expand her food-selling business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married with six children and lives in Mbengwi, a rural town about an hour outside of Bamenda, Cameroon.  Mary plans to buy and sell palm oil and farm on land she already owns.  She will divide her loan between purchasing palm oil, paying for the cultivation of her farm land, and spending on transportation.  She plans to contribute 250,000 CFA (approximately $500 USD) of her own savings towards her business plans.

This is Mary`s fourth loan from GHAPE; she has been a member since 2004.  From her past experience, palm oil is in high demand in her area and she is confident that she can sell it quite quickly.  Bringing palm oil and vegetables from her farm to her community will reduce the transportation costs of her clients. These clients will be able to purchase these items nearby.  She is confident that this loan will allow her to provide more products and therefore sell more.

With the profits from this loan, Mary hopes to expand her business and farming activities.  She also plans to support her children, improve their education, and increase her family`s living standards. She knows she will not have a problem with her repayments because her loan schedule is designed so that her payments are small and regular.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase palm oil, cultivate farm land, and invest in transportation

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy O. is a 40-year-old married woman with one child, who is currently in school. She has been trading for the past five years. she trades in clothing and lace materials. She treks to Nigeria to purchase lace clothes from wholesalers. Mercy believes in hard work and dedication in all aspects of her life. She is one of the successful traders in the Teshie market due to her good customer care. 

She requests for the loan to augment her working capital to enable her purchase additional high-quality products to meet her customers' demands. She hopes to make more income during this festive season to support her family, especially the kid's education. She belongs to the community group known as the Peter Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each others' loans as social collateral and they provide support for one another to repay their respective loans. Mercy was in attendance during her group meeting when photograph was taken.

loans.use: To purchase  higher-quality clothing and lace materials.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama T., 43 ans, mariée  mère de 07 enfants dont deux filles déjà mariées est membre du banc villageois de Kandé Alassane depuis 8 ans. Elle veut acheter des tissus teintés, des bijoux, de l’huile de palme et des poissons séchés pour renforcer son commerce. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer à la charge familiale Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Mariama T., age 43, is married and the mother of seven children, including two daughters who are already married. She has been a member of the village loan group Kandé Alassane for eight years and wants to buy some dyed fabrics, jewelry, palm oil, and dried fish to bolster her commerce. Her income enables her to help cover family expenses. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in dyed cloth, palm oil, and dried fish

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Antonia A. G. es soltera, ella trabaja como empleada domestica en una casa habitación en el cual ya tiene un poco más de 6 años trabajando y le proporciona buenos ingresos, los cuales son de utilidad para solventar los gastos de su casa.
La señora Antonia A. tiene un negocio de venta de artículos usados que es manejado por ella y también le proporciona buenos ingresos.
La señora Antonia A. está solicitando un préstamo para comprar mercancías para su negocio y para arreglar una barda, para que de esta manera su negocio esté más surtido y se puedan incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Antonia Armendariz G. is single and she works as a housekeeper in a private home. She has been working there for more than 6 years and it provides her with good earnings, which are very helpful in keeping up with the household expenses.

Antonia Armendariz managesa business selling used articles and it also provides her with good earnings.

Antonia Armendariz is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise for her business, as well as to fix a wall, so that her business will have better selection and increase her sales.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and repair a wall.

loans.name: Teresa Inés

texts.es:
La señora Teresa es socia del Banco Comunal “03 de Mayo”, distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 30 años de edad, de stado civil conviviente, tiene 03 hijos y posee estudios de secundaría completa. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 08 años; se dedica a la compra y venta de calzados, carne y abarrotes al por menor; su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir mercadería para su negocio (abarrotes: azúcar, arroz, etc.). 
Con este préstamo de S/ 1500.00 nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 5 cuotas mensuales; podrá ampliar su tienda de abarrotes y adquirir mas mercadería, puesto que su sueño es tener en el futuro una bodega distribuidora con diversos productos; asimismo desea que sus hijos sean profesionales, por ello viene ahorrando sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Teresa is a member of the “03 de Mayo” Communal Bank, in the Ilave district, province of El Collao, in the Puno area. She is 30 years old and has a common law marriage. She has 3 children and completed her secondary school studies. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 8 years. She buys and sells wholesale footwear, meat and groceries. Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, with which she acquired merchandise for her business (groceries such as sugar, rice, etc.). With this loan of 1500 nuevos soles, she agrees to commit to paying in 5 monthly payments. She will be able to expand her grocery store and acquire more merchandise, since her dream is to have a distribution shop in the future with diverse products; likewise, she wants her children to become professionals, and for that she has been saving her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise and expand her grocery store, since her dream is to have a distribution shop in the future with diverse products; likewise, she wants her children to become professionals, and for that she has been saving her earnings.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en: Mrs. Ny L. is a villager in Kvav village in Takeo province. She is a basket maker. Her husband, Mr. Lun Sy, is a coconut seller. He now wants to buy a cow for breeding to earn more income. In order to do this, Mrs. Ny L. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow. She is 38 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school while the other is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for her husband to breed.

loans.name: Julia Estela,

texts.es:
Julia solo tiene un año con los préstamos de EDAPROSPO pero lo que ha obtenido gracias a ellos es mucho. Julia es una madre de familia llena de optimismo y entusiasmo al momento de pensar en su futuro.

Empezó trabajando como costurera en una empresa textil, sin embargo debido a una mala experiencia con el cuidado de sus hijos a cargo de otra persona, decidió renunciar y emprender un negocio que le permitiera estar cerca de sus hijos mientras trabajara, ya que ellos solo tienen diez, ocho y cuatro años. En ese entonces eran aún más pequeños. 
Por ello, pensó en vender comida. Con la liquidación de su trabajo en la empresa compro un carrito sanguchero, que es la herramienta principal para quienes venden frituras como ambulante. Durante dos años ha vendido sánguches, salchipapas y demás platos, ofreciendo más platos a medida que su clientela crecía también.

Ahora, esta llevando a cabo el sueño que tuvo desde que empezó con su negocio propio, tener una fuente de soda propia en su casa para poder vender no solo comidas sino también bebidas, ofreciendo una mejor atención a sus clientes. La construcción aun esta a medias, pero ella ya piensa en lo que vendrá después del término de ella: agrandar mas el local para abrir un restaurante.
texts.en:
Julia has been a client of EDAPROSPO for only one year but has made very good use of the loans. Julia is full of optimism and enthusiasm when she thinks of her future. She started working as a seamstress in a textile factory. Because she had a bad experience with the care provided to her children by someone else, she decided to leave her work and open a business which would allow her to be close to her children while she worked as they are only 10, eight and four years old. At that time they were even younger. Because of this, she thought to sell food. With the money from the severance from her work in the factory she bought a street cart which is her main tool from which she travels, selling fried foods. For two years she sold sandwiches, salchipapas [fried hot dogs with french fries] and other foods, offering more dishes as her clientele grew. She is now in the process of making her dream of owning her own business a reality: to have a soda fountain in her home in order to sell drinks as well as food and giving her clients better service. Construction is only halfway done, but she is already thinking of what will come after it is complete: she wants to expand in order to open a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build her new soda fountain

loans.name: Anane

texts.en: Anane Q. sells ladies undergarments in Eguase near Cape Coast.  She is married with 6 dependents and her husband works as a policeman.  Anane has been working as a trader since 2002. She is responsible for helping to pay school fees and utilities. Her loan will be used to further expand her undergarment business. She hopes to use her increased profits to build a home for her family.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to further expand her undergarment business.

loans.name: Funke

texts.en: Funke sells clothes and baby items (baby cream, soap, shoes, etc.). She is 33 years old, married, and has 4 children. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 70,000 ($475 US) to purchase more clothes and baby items to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and baby items to sell.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita M. owns a small sari-sari store. She is 46 years old and has 4 children. She told CEVI, " I just don't like to sit here and wait for husband and children to come. I want to help. I want to contribute something especially in the family income". This is the main reason why she started her business which she has been doing for three years already.

She would like to ask a loan of Php 10,000. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise for her sari sari store. The loan will really help her grow her business so that it will be very easy for them to pay for school, electricity and other expenses in the family.

Through CEVI, Perlita M. was able to sustain her livelihood for years. She has access to the credit assistance, training and insurance coverage services CEVI gives to all their clients.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise for her sari sari store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: stockpiling cereals for resale

loans.name: Mil Flores Group

texts.es: Foto de Izquierda a derecha:  María Teresa
texts.en: Photo from left to right: María Teresa

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to prepare food and sell them on foot.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: Bertha tiene 52 años, es casada y vive con sus 2 hijos quienes estudian carreras profesionales en una universidad de su región. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de chupetes y helados desde su casa, pero no es el único negocio que tiene, ya que también cuenta con un taller de carpintería en otra localidad a dos horas de su casa, donde su esposo es el carpintero y el encargado de fabricar los muebles, mientras ella los comercializa. En taller ya tiene un periodo de 30 años y les ha ido muy bien. Lo que le gusta a Bertha de sus actividades es que se mantiene ocupada, ya que por las mañanas está en su taller de carpintería y por las tardes en su casa vendiendo los chupetes, además ambos negocios le generan el dinero suficiente para solventar sus gastos. Para más adelante les gustaría tener un aserradero. Este es su 7mo crédito con MFP y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que entre todos los miembros se conocen y hay bastante comunicación. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más helados y chupetes en un monto de 100 soles, con lo restante adquirirá madera para fabricar más muebles.
texts.en:
Bertha is 52 and married. She lives with her two children who are studying for professional careers in the regional university. For two years she has been selling lollipops and ice cream from her house. But, that is not the only business she has. She also has a carpentry shop in another location, which is two hours from her house. Her husband is the carpenter, and he is in charge of making the furniture. She sells it. She has had the shop for 30 years, and it has gone very well for them. What Bertha likes about her activities is that they keep her busy. In the mornings she is in her carpentry shop, and in the afternoon she is in her house selling the lollipops. Also, both businesses generate enough income to pay their expenses. Later on she would like to have a sawmill. This is her seventh loan with MFP. What she likes about her community bank is that all of the members know each other and there is good communication. She will use the money she is asking for to buy more ice cream and lollipops for 100 PEN. With the rest of the money she will buy wood to make furniture.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Area Five Group

texts.en:
Sulum is a member of Area Five Group in Kola, Morogoro. She is 40 years old, married and the mother of two children.Her children are ages 15 and 9. She also cares for another seven dependents.

Suluma started her own clothing business, selling clothes for five years. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 600,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Suluma's first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She requested the amount of 200,000 in order to buy more clothes to sell. With the profits she gains from the use of this loan, Suluma hopes to save money and expand her business.

Tausi is another member of Area Five Group. She also requested an amount of 150,000 in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Rafael Alfredo

texts.es: Rafael Alfredo A. vive en Cojutepeque municipio del departamento de Cuscatlán. Rafael de 46 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus dos hijas gemelas de 4 años de edad. Rafael se dedica a la elaboración de mochilas desde su casa, posee doce años de experiencia en su negocio, lo que hoy le permite tener una buena competencia en el mercado ya que el ofrece muy buenos precios y calidad excelente de sus productos. Rafael solicita este crédito para comprar materia prima al por mayor para poder reducir sus costos y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Rafael Alfredo A. lives in the municipality of Cojutepeque, department of Cuscatlán, El Salvador. He is 46 years old and lives with his wife and their two twin daughters, age 4. Rafael makes a living making backpacks in his home, and he has 12 years' experience in the business, which allows him today to have a competitive edge in the marketplace since he offers very good prices and products of excellent quality. Rafael is requesting this loan to purchase raw materials at wholesale in order to reduce his costs and earn better profits.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials to make backpacks

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet M. age 31 is married to a farmer Virgilio M. age 48. In the long years of their marriage they given a two sons, Jan Vergel, 9 years old and he is now in grade 3 in primary level of education, and the other one is Jezreel who is now 4 years old. 

As of now the sources of their income is through farming business that personally manage by his husband Virgillo. This business starts after they got married, when their families lend them a small part of rice field that are ready for cultivation, and they will rent this. This business runs for 10 years now, but still renting the rice field. Janet really hoping to own a rice field someday, that’s why she does all the possible ways to make the business grow bigger. So she decided to get a loan again from Kiva field partner, Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) that will be use in buying things that are needed in the farm like fertilizer and pesticides. She also uses the loan in buying pigs and chickens that needed in her poultry business, the other sources of their income. This poultry business starts when she got her first loan in ASHI, and until now it gives them an extra income.

Janet and Virgilio swear that they will do their best to give their children a better education preparing for their future.

loans.use: To finance her poultry and rice farming business

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en: Arceli S. is from the village of Campo 5, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 33 years old, is married, and has four infant children. Arceli owns and operates a specialized "sari-sari" (variety) store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc., in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2009, Arceli joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Chhem

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhem S. is a 48-year-old married woman and the mother of six children. Five of them are single and the other one is married and lives independently. One of her sons provides a labor service for the local need of ice blocks.

From day to day, Chhem S. goes to buy the necessary ingredients she uses for her cupcakes. She makes them and sells them to the middlemen in bulk and the rest she takes to the market to sell retail. She usually earns an average of $3 a day to be managed for all her family’s living needs.

Chhem S.’s husband is a motor taxi driver. He is buying a motorbike that requires a tax, so Chhem S. would like a loan which will enable her husband to pay the tax. She proposes to use the rest of her loan to sustain her business capital.

loans.use: To pay the tax for her husband's motorbike

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline G. is from the village of Purok 1 Poblacion, Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 25 years old. Evangeline is single and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Evangeline owns & operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling grilled meat (alacarte) such as chicken feet, chicken legs, chicken intestines, pork and others in the local community. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Evangeline joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from HSPFI. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Evangeline from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business and supplement income for the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Percival

texts.en:
Percival has been a hog raiser for two years.  However, her income is not enough to meet the needs of her family.  Because of this, she is asking for financial capital amounting to PHP 7,000 that she needs to purchase a supply of feed and additional piglets to raise.  She is also planning to renovate her pig pens after one year. 

Percival is married to Miguel, a carpenter and a farmer.  The couple were blessed with four children: Victorino, Jerry, Mary Grace, and Visitacion.  Three of them are already married. She hopes that the  lenders will grant her requested loan.

loans.use: To purchase a supply of feed and additonal piglets

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia M. is from the village of Punta. She is 44 years old. Lilia is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Lilia owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling plastic ware and cosmetic products in the local community. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Lilia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the daily needs of the family and tp pay eduction expenses for the children.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Leonides

texts.en:
Leonides C. is from the village of Migpange Bonifacio, Misamis Occ. She is 50 years old. Leonides is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Leonides owns & operates a general store, primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Leonides has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,800 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Leonides joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and give her the ability to engage in business activities. Leonides has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Leonides is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Leonides from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes P. is from the village of Alibagu,Ilagan,Isabela. She is 47 years old, married, and has school-aged children.

Gertrudes owns and operates a furniture making business, making and selling furniture to local businesses and community members. With these activities, she earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Gertrudes joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to make additional furnitures. This loan will be her eighth loan taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 


About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make additional furnitures

loans.name: Wilfredo Antonio

texts.es: Wilfredo Antonio tiene 47 años de edad, su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de enderezado y pintura. Hace mas de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que inicio como aprendiz desde muy joven y ahora es su fuente de trabajo, Wilfredo tenia la responsabilidad de ofrecerles a sus hijos el alimento diario por lo que se preocupaba por aprender muy rápido, además el estaba muy alegre con su actividad económica, el expresa que los financiamientos han sido de mucha ayuda pues son muy importantes para que su negocio salga adelante. El solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Wilfredo Antonio is 47 years old. His economic activity is providing vehicle bodywork and painting services. For more than seven years he has worked in this business, in which he started out as an apprentice when he was very young. Now it's his source of work. Wilfredo had the responsibility of providing daily food to his children, for that reason he was concerned about learning his business quickly. Furthermore, he has been very happy with his economic activity. He says that the loans have been a lot of help, as they are very important for his business to move forward. He is requesting the loan for working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Guillermina es socia del Banco Comunal Las Gaviotas.
Guillermina es casada y tiene 59 años, Guillermina se dedica a la elaboración de chicha de jora que se elabora en base a maíz, sus ventas los realiza de acuerdo a pedidos, a restaurantes.
Guillermina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar.
Los sueños de Guillermina son mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Guillermina is a member of the Communal Bank Las Gaviotas ["The Seagulls"]. Guillermina is married and she is 59 years old. She works in the production of chicha de jora, which is an alcoholic beverage made from fermented corn. She makes her sales according to the orders she receives from restaurants. Guillermina needs a 1,000.00 PEN loan which she will invest in the purchase of sugar. Guillermina's dreams are to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sugar

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.en: Emiliana D. is from the village of Daanglungsod. She is 62 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Emiliana owns and operates a tailoring business, providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. In 2007, Emiliana joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Emiliana is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This loan will be her 7th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Aliyyah

texts.en:
Aliyyah S. is from the village of Talakag Bukidnon. She is 20 years old. Aliyyah is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Aliyyah owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling video compact disc (VCD's) in the local community. Aliyyah has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Aliyyah joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aliyyah has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Aliyyah is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be the secondloan taken out by Aliyyah from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina L. is from the village of Magting, Mambajao Camiguin Province. She is 36 years old. Regina is separated from her spouse and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Regina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Regina has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately $75 a month from this activity.

In 2010, Regina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Regina is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel tiene 61 años, es una mujer que a lo largo de su vida siempre ha querido brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Clímaco de 68 años y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila.

Su trabajo es el cultivo de maíz y papas, esta labor la realiza junto a su esposo, quien también trabaja arduamente para obtener ingresos para su familia. Isabel ha visto por conveniente llevar sus productos hasta el mercado mayorista de la ciudad, ya que según manifiesta, es ahí donde mejores ganancias obtiene.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden amenazar su productividad, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que el camino es muy largo y agotador. Con el tiempo, espera comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos y con su venta pueda mejorar sus ingresos económicos.

Este es el primer préstamo de Isabel con MFP, se siente en la obligación de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más abono para sus cultivos y contratará operarios para que trabajen sus tierras.
texts.en:
Isabel is 61 years old and is a woman who, throughout her life, has always wanted to provide the best to her children. She lives in her own house together with her 68-year-old husband, Clímaco, and what she wants most is to have a calm retirement.

She works cultivating corn and potatoes, which she does together with her husband, who also works hard to obtain income for the family. Isabel has seen it to be convenient to bring her products to the city’s wholesale market, where according to evidence is where she has the best earnings.

What she likes most about her work is caring for her crops against diseases that can threaten their productivity.
