She has been in this business for 20 years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting her products, since the road is very long and tiring. With time, she hopes to purchase new lands to increase her cultivation and with their sale, she can improve her income.

This is Isabel’s first loan with MFP. She feels an obligation to make her payments on time, as she does not want to cause any problems for the members of her communal bank, where she is very well-liked. With the 1,000 PEN requested, she will purchase more fertilizer for her crops and will hire machine workers to work on her lands.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and hire workers

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
Zahida is from a city named Lahore in Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods. 

She is 43 years old and married. She always had a wish to get a good education but she couldn’t continue her studies after completing the 8th standard (grade) because of her mother’s bad health. Her presence became important at her house.

She got married at the age of 18 to a man whose name is J. I. who is a hawker (trader). He specifically deals with vegetables. He has been in this profession for the past six years. He purchases the vegetables from the vegetable markets and sells to the different areas on his four wheel cart. 

She is the mother of three sons. Her eldest son is involved in a paint business. The next one in age to him is involved in a business sewing clothes and her youngest son is in school and reads in the 10th standard.
  
Zahida is a regular client of Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). She has maintained a good record of repayment for the last three years. She describes herself as a hardworking lady because she has run her own grocery shop at her house for the past two years. She has a good number of customers.

She is applying for a loan for the fourth time to purchase groceries (rice, lentils and cooking oil) to expand her grocery shop.

loans.use: Purchase groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica W. sells and designs bedsheets and is requesting a loan to stock more bedsheets to sell.  Monica is 29 years-old and is married with a husband that is a driver. She has two children and they go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to purchase a sewing machine for designing bedsheets.

Kiva partner BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 female members.

loans.use: To purchase bedsheets to sell.

loans.name: Yuri Rosemery

texts.es: Yuri Rosemery A. M. de 33 años de vida, vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja para la policía Nacional Civil, junto a su pequeño hijo de 9 años de edad y su padre, residen en Ilopango, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Yuri se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos como crema, queso y requesón, así mismo comercializa carne de res y chorizos, su venta esta ubicada en el mercado de Ilopango, en donde posee varios clientes los cuales le compran semanal sus productos. Es por esta razón que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más productos lácteos y así mismo más carne, ya que este es un negocio muy bueno y estable, el cual le brindar muy buenas ganancias, por lo que desea hacerlo crecer más. De esta manera Yuri desea poder superarse como comerciante y así mismo brindarle una vida mejor a su hijo en la cual posee todo lo necesario para tener una vida digna.
texts.en:
Yuri Rosemery A. M., 33, lives with her husband, who works for the National Civil Police, her 9-year-old son and her father in Ilopango, San Salvador department. Yuri sells dairy products like cream, cheese and requesón (similar to ricotta or cottage cheese); she has several regular customers that buy from her weekly. She needs funds to buy more dairy products and meat because this is a profitable and stable business and she wants to increase her sales and make it grow more. Yuri hopes to improve as a merchant this way and provide a better life for her son in which he has all that is needed to live a dignified life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dairy products and cream.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
Sixty-year-old John is the married father of four children who are all adults. He is a dairy farmer from Central Kenya near Murang'a town where he has been farming for over thirty years. He has employed two people from the community to help on his farm. His main product is milk which he sells to Brookside Company in Murang’a town. He also earns income from coffee, bananas and maize that he sells to the local market.

John’s major challenge is lack of a stable market, poor milk prices and transportation problems during the rainy season.

John has requested this Kes 53,000 loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This loan will enable him acquire a quality dairy cow that will increase his milk production and earn enough income to enable him to pay his workers and meet his other basic needs.

In five years time, John intends to acquire a pure breed of dairy cattle producing over 50 liters of milk per day.
He says "Juhudi is doing a commendable job in improving the lives of peasant farmers.”

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Pableo' Group

texts.en:
Angielita P. is from the village of Villaramos, Manukan, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old. Angielita is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is P.'s Group.

Angielita is married and has three adult children. Angielita owns and operates a business raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Angielita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns an average of approximately 1,500 Philippine pesos (PHP)  a month from it.

In 2010, Angielita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Angielita is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for hog raising. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Angielita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for hog raising

loans.name: Rang

texts.en:
Rang S., 43 years old, owns a small shop located along the street where she sells soft drinks and food. She typically makes around US$ 10 in profit each day to ensure that her family has a comfortable life. She was married but she divorced her husband years ago. She now has two school-aged kids, one of whom attends university and other one attends a high school. 

Rang S. is running her business smoothly because she has skills in public relations which she uses with her customers. She also faces a problem: her shop is too old and not attractive to the customers. To solve an obstacle, Rang S. would like to request a loan to be used to decorate her shop which will allow her to add new customers to her clientele.

loans.use: To decorate her shop so as to be more attractive to her customers

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 64 años, vive con su esposo en su casa propia. DesD. hace 20 años que tiene una tienda ubicada, negocio que se encuentra en un espacio D. su casa, comercializa diariamente productos D. primera necesidad como: arroz, azúcar, entre otros. Cada semana se abastece D. mercadería aunque en algunas ocasiones son lo proveedores que van a su establecimiento.  Durante este tiempo D. trabajo, ha visto que  este negocio le ha resultado rentable y afirma que le agrada estar trabajando en su tienda porque le permite estar activa todo el día, es por esa razón que seguirá trabajando por mas años. Es su catorceavo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta D. saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, utilizará en la compra D. mercadería para su tienda.
texts.en:
María is 64 years old, and she is the owner of the house she lives in with her husband. About 20 yeas ago she established a shop in a room of her house: here she daily sells products such as rice and sugar, among other everyday necessities. Every week she refurnishes herself with products, and sometimes her suppliers go directly to her shop. In the years she has been working, she has realized that this activity is profitable for her; she states that she likes working in her shop as this activity keeps her busy during the day, and for this reason she will keep on working for many years to come. This is her fourteenth loan with MFP; she is very happy to know she can count on financial support, as she has always demonstrated being responsible with her repayments; she moreover enjoys being part of her communal bank because all of its members are responsible and very caring people. She is thankful to those that will manage the loan she is requesting, which will be very useful in making her activity grow. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy products for her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more products to refurnish her shop.

loans.name: Las Alfareras Group

texts.es:
el grupo Las Alfareras estan ubicadas en la aldea de Agua Frillita jurisdiccion de Nacaome, Valle.
Son cuatro integrantes, vecinas y conocidas de la comunidad, son mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras.
con muchos deseos de salir adelante con sus negocios y con sus familias, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:

doña Etelvina P. es lider del grupo y tiene 64 años de edad, esta casada y tiene dos hijos, Etelvina se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de artesania. 

La señora Alma Yudith C. tiene 29 años de edad, es madre soltera  y tiene una hija, Alma se dedica a la comercializacion de golosinas, venta de tortillas, paletas de leche. 
el credito lo invertira en su negocio.

doña Ines Albertina O. tiene 42 años de edad, tiene 5 hijos que dependen al 100% de ella.
Ines y su esposo se dedican a la fabricacion de hoyas de barro, cantaros, gallos, floreros, y otros adornos de alfareria, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace varios años en su casa de habitacion,

la sra. Fidelina R. C. tiene 52 años de edad,  esta casada y no tiene hijos.
Fidelina se dedica a la compra y venta de abarroteria. Tambien tiene una pulperia y el credito lo utilizara en la compra de refrescos, abarroteria y repuestos para bicicleta.
texts.en:
The group "Las Alfareras" is located in the neighborhood of Agua Frillita in the city of Nacaome, in the Valle department. There are 4 members, who are neighbors and acquaintances from the community. They are very hardworking and enterprising women who have a strong desire to get ahead with their businesses and their families. Detail is provided below concerning their respective businesses: Etelvina P. is the leader of the group. She is 64 years old, married, and has 2 children. Etelvina makes and sells handicrafts. Alma Yudith C. is 29 years old, and is a single mother of a daughter. Alma sells snacks, tortillas and milk-flavored popsicles. She will use the loan to invest in her business. Ines Albertina O. is 42 years old, and has 5 dependent children. Ines and her husband make earthenware basins, jugs, vases, and other items of pottery, including decorative items such as roosters. They have been doing this type of work for a number of years in their home. Fidelina R. C. is 52 years old, married, and has no children. Fidelina has a business selling groceries. In addition, she has a small store and she will use this loan to buy soft drinks, groceries, and spare parts for bicycles.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy beans, milk, rice, butter, paints, brushes, toilet paper, corn and wheat flour, tortillas, cereal, oatmeal, sanitary napkins, molds, and spare parts for bicycles

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina H. is from the town of Talibon. She is 26 years old. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. 

Divina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Divina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr:
MARIE S. est une femme de 24 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de WASSADOU depuis le 07 août 2009. 

MARIE S. est une commerçante. Elle vend diverses denrées alimentaires dans une boutique. Tels du lait en poudre dans des sachets, des boîtes de sardines, des biscuits etc. 

Elle s'est investie dans cette activité depuis environs 3 ans. Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de renforcer son approvisionnement en marchandises afin de réaliser plus de bénéfices.

Les bénéfices réalisés à partir de son activité lui permettront de mieux gérer sa famille, participer à la prise en charge de la scolarité, la nourriture, et la santé de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Marie S. is a 24-year old woman. She is married and mother to three children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois in Wassadou since 7th August 2009. Marie is a businesswoman, who sells various food products in a shop. These include powdered milk in sachets, cans of sardines, biscuits etc. She has been active in this business for around three years. Her new loan will allow her to stock up with goods in order to make more money. The profits she makes from her business will allow her to manage her family better, contribute to her children's schooling, food and health expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To get fresh supplies for her shop

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita D. is from the village of San Jose, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 59 years old. Emelita is widowed and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Emelita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Emelita has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Emelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Emelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Emelita is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Emelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Bayar-Erdene

texts.en: Bayar-Erdene B. is 25 years old and lives with his wife and one year old daughter in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. His wife is currently unemployed and stays at home with her infant baby while Bayar-Erdene operates a raw material retail business in his town. He began his business in 2004 with the help of his uncle and after lots of hard work and determination, Bayar-Erdene operates his business independently. Initially, he purchased raw materials using his uncle's money and earned a small profit. In 2007, he has purchased his own van after selling his livestock (approximately 150 animals). He purchases his raw materials from herders in rural areas by traveling in his van and sells them for a profit at the central market. Since 2009, he started purchasing  raw materials in the local market where his customers and suppliers can come to him. He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more raw materials.

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials

loans.name: Ghassan

texts.en:
Ghassan is a 52-year-old married man, father of three children. Ghassan works as a mobile fruit & vegetable dealer. He moves from one village to another to sell his products. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to buy a Renault Rapid car necessary for expanding his business region. 

Ghassan is well organized and a man with a good reputation. His clients like dealing with him because his products are very fresh & tasty. He hopes to expand his business through opening a wholesale storage.

loans.use: To buy a Renault Rapid car necessary for expanding his business

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica G. is from the village of Pelaez, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 42 years old. Jessica is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, toothpaste, junk foods, detergents, bath soap and dried fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $250 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jessica joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Jessica is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen’s husband, S. A., runs a business selling cooking oil. He has a shop in the market from where he sells the oil to other grocery stores and to common buyers at cheap rates. Nasreen supports her family financially by doing embroidery. She has a good number of clients in her neighborhood who prefer her quality work and give her regular orders every month.

Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He plans to use the loan to buy cooking oil in bulk to expand his business further. He has been operating this business for the past 15 years and Nasreen is confident that with the loan investment, his business will definitely improve. Nasreen is a regular lender with Asasah and this is her 5th loan application. In previous loan years, she has proved herself to be a responsible client, always paying her installments on time and never missing a single meeting.

Nasreen is a very helpful person. She lives in Kasur, a small city in Pakistan known for its leather industry. She has lived with her family in a 2-room brick house in the area of Dungipura for over 20 years. Nasreen has 2 sons and a daughter. Her elder son left his education and started working with his father in his business. Her remaining 2 children are enrolled in school.

Note: In the photo, Nasreen in holding a book (the Asasah Passbook).

loans.use: to buy cooking oil in bulk

loans.name: Moises

texts.es: Moisés, de 28 años, convive con Mary, de 22 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Ronaldo, de 7 y Anderson, de un año. En unión familiar ellos viven en una casa alquilada, ubicada en la ciudad de Tarma. La siembra de papa y arveja, es su principal actividad, ya tiene 18 años dedicándose a ello y asegura que se siente muy feliz, de poder desarrollar la actividad que le enseñaron sus padres. Sus producciones, después de cada cosecha los comercializa en el mercado mayorista de su localidad, donde también trabaja con su triciclo, cargando y descargando, sacos de papa y fanegas de verduras. Los días de mayor acogida, son los miércoles, viernes y domingos, donde toda la población visita el mercado para hacer las compras de la semana. Es por ello que más adelante desea, juntar un capital considerable de dinero, para poder comprar una moto y con eso comenzar a trabajar en el trasporte público, cubriendo rutas en los alrededores de la ciudad. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, y como buen integrante de su banco comunal, está seguro que podrá salir adelante, gracias al apoyo y colaboración que recibe. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico, fertilizantes naturales, y 2 bolsas de semilla de arveja, que oscilan entre los 600 a 700 nuevos soles cada una.
texts.en:
Moisés is 28 years old.  He lives together with Mary who is 22.  They have 2 children: 7 year-old Ronaldo and 1 year-old Anderson.  They live in a rented house in the city of Tarma.  Moisés' main business activity is growing potatoes and peas.  He has been doing this for 18 years and he tells us that feels very happy to be able to engage in this activity which his parents taught him.

After each harvest, Moisés sells his produce in the wholesale market in his town.  He also works in the town with his 'triciclo' (three-wheeled vehicle), loading and unloading sacks of potatoes and large quantities of vegetables.  His best days are Wednesdays, Fridays and Sundays because then everybody visits the market to do their weekly shopping.  In the future, he would like to father together a considerable sum of money to be able to buy a motorbike and use it to provide a public transport service, covering routes in the areas around the city.

This is Moisés' fifth loan from MFP and, as a good member of his community bank, he is certain that he will be able to get ahead, thanks to the support and collaboration that he receives.  He will use his loan to buy several sacks of organic fertilizer, natural fertilizers and 2 bags of pea seeds which cost between 600 and 700 Peruvian soles each.

loans.use: To buy several sacks of fertilizer and 2 bags of pea seeds

loans.name: Sara Nohemy

texts.es: Sara Nohemy T. D. P. D. 37 años D. edad, resiD. en Colón, en el departamento D. La Libertad. Ella vive únicamente junto a su esposo quien trabaja para una empresa privada. Sara posee una tienda D. productos perecederos, la cual esta ubicada en su casa D. habitación, negocio el cual le permite contar con todo lo necesario para el hogar, es por esta razón que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda  contar con el dinero necesario para equipar su negocio con todo lo necesario para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, ya que en muchas ocasiones se ve obligada a perder algunas ventas, ya que no posee los productos que le solicitan, circunstancias las cuales ella desea poder cambiar, para mejorar y salir adelante con su negocio. Francisca es una señora muy visionaria quien siempre desea salir adelante e ir creciendo día con día por el bienestar D. ella y su hogar, ya que para ella es muy importante poder aportar a su casa y D. esta forma poder vivir D. una manera tranquila en la cual pueda contar con todo lo necesario para su esposo y ella.
texts.en:
Sara Nohemy T. D. P. is 37 years old.  She lives in Colón, in La Libertad department with her husband who works for a private company.

Sara owns a store where she sells perishables.  The store is located in her home and allows her to have everything she needs for her household.  She is requesting a loan that will allow her to have the money she needs to fit out her business with everything she needs to proviD. a better service to her customers since she often has to miss out on sales because she doesn't have the products that customers are asking for.  She would like to change this situation, to improve and to get ahead in her business.  Sara is a very visionary lady who always wants to get ahead and grow day by day for her own well-being and that of her family.  For Sara, it is very important to be able to contribute to her household and thereby be able to live more peacefully and have everything she needs for her husband and herself.

loans.use: To buy perishables

loans.name: Lena's Group

texts.en:
Lena A. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Bokonbaevo, a nice village in Isykul region. Lena, 43, is married to a constructor. Together they bring up two daughters; both of them are at school. Three years ago with the initial investment of 5000 soms, Lena and her husband started to breed livestock. Reselling livestock after fattening, they earn 2000 soms per month. The family applied for the loan because they need money to purchase three more livestock animals for breeding. In the future. Lena wants to improve the family’s living conditions and provide her children good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135P.

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa, es una mujer luchadora de 39 años, que junto a su esposo Bernabé; cuida de su hija Anali, a la que aman y educan en su casa propia ubicada, en Pueblo Pardo (selva central peruana). Todas las tardes de verano, el negocio de Elsa, tiene gran acogida, pues los ricos helados, bebidas, y raspadillas, refrescan a los pobladores de la ciudad. Según menciona en época de verano sus ganancias son muy buenas, tanto así que deja de dedicarse a la agricultura, otra de sus actividades. Hace 15 años, las 2 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas que posee, le proporcionan una variedad de frutas, como: carambola, mandarina y mango; los que después de fertilizarlos, cuidarlos y podarlos, los comercializa en el mercado central de la ciudad. Por el éxito de su negocio, está pensando invertir en el mejoramiento de su casa en la ciudad de La Merced, para más adelante abrir una fuente de soda. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Caramboleros”, y este es el sexto préstamo con MFP, donde es un socia responsable y comprometida con el desarrollo de su banco comunal. Dentro de poco, los naranjales de Elsa darán fruto, por ello está pensando invertir el crédito en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico, los cuales esparcirá entre sus plantaciones, para obtener buenos frutos.
texts.en:
Elsa is a hardworking, 39 year old woman, who along with husband Bernabé, takes care of her daughter Anali, who they love very much and educate en their own home, which is located in Pueblo Pardo (in the central Peruvian forest).   Every afternoon in the summer, Elsa's business gets a great reception, since the delicious ice creams, drinks and shaved ices refresh the city's population.  She mentions that in the summer season her income is very good, so much that she stops working on the farm, another one of her activities.  

For 15 years, the 2 hectares of farmland that she has have been dedicated to a variety of fruits such as starfruit, mandarin oranges and mangoes.  After fertilizing them, caring for them, and pruning them, she sells them in the central market of the city.  In order for her business to be successful, she plans to invest in improving her house in the city of La Merced, in order to be able to open a soda fountain.  

She belongs to the village bank "Los Caramboleros" and this is the sitch loan with MFP, where she is a responsible member and committed to the development of the bank.  Soon, Elsa's orange trees will bear fruit, so she wants to invest the money from the loan in the purchase of some sacks of organic compost, which she will spread over her plantations to get good fruit.

loans.use: Buy sacks of compost

loans.name: Dolgorsuren

texts.en: Dolgorsuren is 31 years old and lives with her two children in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her son attends a local secondary school. They live in their own ger (Mongolian nomadic housing tent). Dolgorsuren began her meat-trading business in 2000. She purchases meat and milk products from local individuals who bring their products from the countryside to sell in the city using her micro bus. She is hardworking and someone with initiative who wants to expand her business and increase her profit. Dolgorsuren's further wish is to give a better education to her children and build her own house. She is requesting a loan of of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase more meat for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more meat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase cooking gas cylinders to fill for sale

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida A. is a seamstress at Takoradi near Effiakuma Estate. She has completed her senior high school education and is married to a teacher. They have two children. 
She has been a seamstress for two years, and the income helps pay for the household expenses. Her loan will be used to purchase lining, buttons, zippers, and others items to enable to her sew clothes for sale. This will help increase her income and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase lining, buttons, zippers and others items to enable to her sew clothes for sale.

loans.name: Aura Lila

texts.es: Aura Lila de Veintinueve años reside en Somotillo, es madre de 2 hijos que tiene bajo su custodia. Aura encontró en este negocio las necesidades diarias tanto de sus hijos como ella. Razón por la cual encontró en la venta de cosméticos por catalogo una excelente opción de cuidar a sus hijos y hacerse de dinero para costear necesidades básicas de sus vidas. Este es uno de los mejores momentos para invertir pues se acerca la temporada de verano. Con este crédito comprara brillo, pintura de labios, pintura de labios, polvos, cremas, tratamientos, perfumes y lociones a fin de incrementar su inventario y contar con nuevos productos que le piden sus clientes y vecinos a fin de mejorar cada día la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Aura Lila, age 21, resides in Somotillo and is the mother of two children in her custody. She has a business that provides for the daily needs of herself and her children. Aura determined that selling cosmetics was an excellent way to take care of her children and earn money to her cover her basic living necessities. The approaching summer season is one of the best times to invest.

With this loan she will buy lip gloss, lipsticks, powders, crèmes, treatments, perfumes, and lotions to increase her inventory and offer new products that her customers and neighbors request. In this manner, she hopes to improve her quality of life each day.

loans.use: To purchase lip gloss, lipsticks, powders, crèmes, treatments, perfumes, and lotions.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Carmen es habitantante de un lugar llamado Tierra Blanca el cual significa novia del del sol, la cual es una region ganadera. Doña Carmen tiene la edad de 40 años, estudio solo la primaria y esta casada cone el señor esteban el cual es policia con el cual tiene dos hijos los cuales trabajan y ayudan con los gastos del hogar.

Ella nos dijo "como en estos tiempos la situacion economica esta muy fea ya la mujer no se queda en casa tambien tienemos que buscar el dinero", ella nos platica que inicio vendiendo oro pero commo es muy caro no le dejo buenas ganancias a si que cambio e inicio a vender ropa y perfumes, ella vende casa por casa con sus amigos y vecinos.

ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de ropa (shots, pantalones, blusas, camisas, playeras, clasetines, ropa interior)y perfumes para dama y caballero para su porterior venta. ella desea que con esta inversion las ganancias aumenten ya que desea que su hijo el mas pequeño regrese a la escuela y seguir invirtiendo porque espera que su negocio prospere.
texts.en:
Sra. Carmen is a resident of a place called Tierra Blanca, which is also known as “The Bride of the Sun”. In addition to being a livestock region, it is one of the warmest places in the State of Veracruz. Doña Carmen is 40 years old and only has an elementary school education. She is married to Sr. Esteban who works as a police officer. They have two children who work and help with the household expenses.

Carmen says, “During these bad economic times, a woman should not stay at home but try to earn some money.” She indicates that she started out selling gold, but since it is expensive, she was not able to generate good earnings. Carmen switched to selling clothing and perfumes. She sells to her friends and neighbors by going house to house.

Carmen needs this loan to invest in the purchase of clothing such as shorts, trousers, blouses, shirts, T-shirts, socks, and undergarments. She will also acquire perfumes for women and men to sell later. Carmen hopes that this investment will increase her earnings because she desires for her youngest son to return to school. She wants to continue investing so that her business will prosper.

loans.use: To purchase clothing and perfumes.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Lilibeth works hard to support her family. She has a tricycle transport rental business in the Philippines. Lilibeth has requested a loan of 21,000 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to buy new tools and equipment for her tricycle transport rental business.
Lilibeth has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase new tools and equipment.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 31 years old. She is married with four children between the ages of 3 and 10 years old. Josephine earns a living by selling various goods such as: soft drinks, lotion, toilet papers etc. This is her tenth successful year in this business. Her business is well-organized. She operates her business from 6 a.m. until 7 p.m. every day except on the weekends and she employs one person to help her.

Josephine has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to buy more varied goods to sell such as: soft drinks, lotion, toilet papers etc. By expanding her business and adding more goods and workers, Josephine hopes to earn more profits. She will save for her future and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more various goods to sell such as: soft drinks, lotion, toilet papers, etc.

loans.name: Jesutogbe 2 Group

texts.fr: JESUTOGBE 2 est un groupe de dix personnes, dont les membres habitent ensemble dans la même agglomération. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité et de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupe s'est rapproché de ALIDé, en vue de l'obtention d'un crédit. La représentante du groupe, Suzanne (dont le doigt est levé sur la photo), est née en 1968 à Aguégué au Bénin. Suzanne est mariée à un pêcheur du nom de Théodore et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Suzanne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Suzanne n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Afin de se prendre en charge et de contribuer aux dépenses familiales, Suzanne vend de la bouillie (faite à base de maïs) accompagnée de beignets (à base de farine de blé) et du sucre à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Suzanne vend des nattes. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Suzanne achète ses produits. Ce crédit permettra à Suzanne et à son groupe d’augmenter leur chiffre d’affaire et d’accroître leur profit.
texts.en: JESUTOGBE 2 is a group of ten individuals, whose members live in the same village. To increase their commercial activity and to better meet the demands of their customers, this group has approached ALIDé to obtain a loan. The representative of the group, Suzanne (whose hand is raised in the photo), was born in 1968 in Aguégués, Benin. Suzanne is married to a fisherman named Theodore and is the mother of three children, all attending school. Suzanne lives with her ​​husband and children. The couple works together to pay off household expenses. Suzanne did not attend school. In order to support the family and contribute to domestic expenses, Suzanne sells porridge (made ​​from corn) with fritters (made from wheat flour) and sugar at home. Secondarily, Suzanne sells mats. Suzanne buys her products at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. This loan will allow Susan and her group to increase their sales and profit.

loans.use: Purchase corn, wheat flour, and sugar.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge es un padre de familia de 52 años, vive con su esposa e hijo en su casa propia, ubicada en el distrtito de Mochumí, a unos 20 minutos del departamento de Lamabayeque.  Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura y   ganadería.

Jorge se dedica hace 10 años a las labores agricolas en sus tierras cultiva donde siembra maíz y frijol, es un alimento sano y rico para el consumo diario de los pobladores que lo comercializa en el mercado Moshoqueque de Chiclayo, vendiendolo al por mayor y menor,con la finalidad de aumentar sus ingresos y poder solventar sus obligaciones en su hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo  de 1500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para la compra de fertilizantes y pesticidas para preparar sus terrenos y mejorar sus tierras y su producto, el cual posteriormente será vendido para el consumo de los pobladores.  La venta de su maíz y frijol mejorará la calidad de vida de su familia.

José es conocido por las personas que también se dedican a esa actividad, por ser trabajador y responsable, con el único objetivo de brindarles a su hijo una mejor oportunidad en la vida.
texts.en:
Jorge es un padre de familia de 52 años, vive con su esposa e hijo en su casa propia, ubicada en el distrtito de Mochumí, a unos 20 minutos del departamento de Lamabayeque.  Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura y   ganadería.

Jorge se dedica hace 10 años a las labores agricolas en sus tierras cultiva donde siembra maíz y frijol, es un alimento sano y rico para el consumo diario de los pobladores que lo comercializa en el mercado Moshoqueque de Chiclayo, vendiendolo al por mayor y menor,con la finalidad de aumentar sus ingresos y poder solventar sus obligaciones en su hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo  de 1500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para la compra de fertilizantes y pesticidas para preparar sus terrenos y mejorar sus tierras y su producto, el cual posteriormente será vendido para el consumo de los pobladores.  La venta de su maíz y frijol mejorará la calidad de vida de su familia.

José es conocido por las personas que también se dedican a esa actividad, por ser trabajador y responsable, con el único objetivo de brindarles a su hijo una mejor oportunidad en la vida.

loans.use: Compra de fertilizantes y pesticidas para mejorar sus tierras de cultivo y producto

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma is 33 years old and has given birth to a daughter who is 3 years old. She is a housewife and carries out her household responsibilities by staying at home. She is very active and performs her work very well. Her husband has a dairy business. For that purpose, he has two buffalos and also three cows. Najma’s husband is a very hardworking person. He gets up early in the morning and  milks the buffalos and cows to sell to his community clients. Najma provides full support to him in operating his business. She takes care of his cattle and also assists him in getting the milk. 

Najma has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, because her husband wants to buy another dairy cow. This will help him get larger quantities of milk to meet the needs of his customers. He has been operating his business for the past 20 years and Najma is confident that an investment will help him improve it further.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow.

loans.name: Widad

texts.en:
Widad is a 39-year-old married woman living in Ain with her husband. She opened a bakery to help her husband to cover their expenses and to improve their living conditions. Widad works hard to improve her business. She has requested a loan from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, for the third time, in order to buy flour and other necessary baking materials for the business.
 
Widad is a borrower of good standing. Her customers are relatives, neighbors, and friends. She's honest and a woman who provides good customer service. She hopes to expand her business and to continue providing healthy living for her family. Widad operates her shop from her home; in that way she takes good care of both family and business at the same time.

loans.use: to buy flour and other necessary baking materials

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Juan es casado, tiene 35 años de edad, tiene un hijo, con quien vive en casa propia.
Juan es muy trabajador, ya que trabaja de lunes a lunes. Dice que de lunes a viernes trabaja en una estación de expendio de combustibles y fines de semana trabaja vendiendo de forma ambulante todo tipo de artículos. Gracias al esfuerzo conjunto, es decir, el de él y su esposa, lograron construir una casa y su máximo sueño es elevar su nivel de vida y así aportar a su hijo una buena educación y que el día de mañana cuente con el apoyo suficiente para lograr una profesión digna para enfrentar los vaivenes económicos que sufren los habitantes del tercer mundo.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de sabanas, frazadas, y demás para la posterior venta. Cree que el credito le sera de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Juan is married, 35 years old, and has one son. He sells a variety of items from door to door, a profession he learned from infancy because his parents also did this type of work and taught him the same. Juan is very industrious, working every day of the week. He notes that his wife supports him by producing bedspreads, which minimizes the cost. Thanks to their joint efforts, they succeeded in building a house. Their greatest dream is to improve their quality of life and to give their son a good education so that, in the future, he can secure a dignified job to help him face the economic swings suffered by inhabitants of the third world.

He is requesting this loan to buy more sheets, blankets, and other items to resell. He thinks that this loan will be a great help.

loans.use: to purchase sheets, blankets, and other items

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
MatilD. tiene 54 años D. edad, ella es casada y tiene 4 hijos D. los cuales 3 están en el colegio, MatilD. cuenta con vivienda propia la misma que esta ubicada en un caserío llamado la Matanza en el distrito D. Morropón, al norte del país en el departamento D. Piura, su comunidad por ser rural aun no cuenta con todos loa servicios básicos.

MatilD. se dedica desD. hace más D. 8 años a la compra y venta D. ganado vacuno. Ella los cría en amplios corrales y cuando estos han alcanzado un buen nivel D. desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes D. la zona y a los vecinos y pobladores del distrito. Adicionalmente ella tiene un pequeño negocio D. venta D. frutas el cual realiza los fines D. semana. Con estos ingresos  que el obtiene D. estas actividades se encarga D. sacar adelante a su familia.

Ella desea comprar animales para engorD. y alimentarlos con productos balanceados y  poder así mejorar el desarrollo D. sus animales y venderlos a mejor precio, además desea ampliar sus negocio D. frutas.  Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2500 nuevos soles.

MatilD. es una persona trabajadora, activa y bastante responsable. Las personas que la conocen la consideran una mujer tranquila y confiable.
texts.en:
MatilD. is 54, married, and has 4 children, 3 of whom are in school. MatilD. has her own home located in a hamlet called La Matanza in the district of Morropon, in the north of the country in the department of Piura. Because her community is rural, they still do not have all of the basic services.

MatilD. has bought and sold cattle for over 8 years. She raises them in large corrals, and when they have reached a good level of development she sells them to the local businesspeople and to her neighbours and the local residents. She also has a small business selling fruits on the weekends. With the income from these businesses she takes charge of getting her family ahead.

She wants to buy animals for fattening, and feed them balanced products in order to improve their development and sell them at a better price. She also wants to expand her fruit business. For this reason she has decided to request a loan of 2500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

MatilD. is a hard-working, active and very responsible person. Those who know her say she is calm and trustworthy.

loans.use: to purchase cattle with balanced food for better development.

loans.name: Santos Javier

texts.es:
Santos de 20 años, es soltero, vive en casa de unos familiares, la cual cuenta con sólo servicios de luz, ubicado en el distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Santos desde hace un año se dedica a la comercialización de animales de corral (cerdos, cabras, ovejas y aves de corral), los cría en sus corrales que tiene en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada, granos y pastos naturales, una vez que hayan completado su crecimiento ideal, los vende a sus clientes o en los diferentes mercados de la zona  y con los ingresos podrá cubrir sus necesidades personales.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para compra de alimento balanceado, una vez que los engorde los comercializa a sus clientes, con las ganancias que obtenga pagará el crédito otorgado y mejorará su calidad de vida.  Santos con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo está tratando de salir sólo adelante y superarse por sus propios medios.
texts.en:
Santos is 20 years old, single, and lives in the home of some relatives. The only service they receive is electricity. Santos resides in the District of Tambogrande, which is part of the Department of Piura. This area is known for its businesses involving agriculture, livestock breeding, and handicrafts.

For the past year, Santos has been selling domesticated animals such as pigs, goats, sheep, and chickens. The animals are kept in pens located behind his house and are fed balanced feed, grains, and natural grasses. Once the animals have completed their growth to the ideal level, Santos sells them to his customers or at the different markets in the area. With the income he earns, Santos is able to cover his personal needs.

He is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN so that he can buy balanced feed for fattening his animals before selling them to his customers. With the revenue he generates, Santos will be able to repay the loan and improve his quality of life. Through much work and effort, Santos strives to move forward and succeed on his own.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for his animals.

loans.name: Milyn

texts.en:
Milyn is married with three children. Milyn is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Milynl is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase lumber for her house repair. 

She has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Milyn hopes to be successful in her chosen business.

loans.use: to purchase lumber for her house repair.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is from the village of Santa Filomena. She  has been engaged in farming for the past three years. With her honesty and hard work, she hopes to continue growing her business. 

Teresa is looking for a loan to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. She prefers microfinance institutions because of their products and customer-friendly attitude. 

This loan will increase her total investment in the business by 25 percent, and she expects her income to increase by 20 percent. 

Teresa enjoys the nature of Santa Filomena and lives close to her relatives.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mzia

texts.en:
Mzia is from the village Dablatsikhe, Imereti Region, West Georgia. She is 60 years old and lives with her family: her husband Amrosi, a 40 year old son, her daughter in law and her 6 year old grandson. Her grandson goes to school. 

Mzia owns a small grocery store in her village. She purchases grocery products in Kutaisi's (nearby town) wholesale market once each month. Mzia’s clients are the villagers. Her daily turnover is 50 Laris. Along with the above mentioned trade business, Mzia is also involved in family agricultural activities – they have 2 milk cows. She produces and sells on average 25 kg of cheese per month. Mzia’s husband and son are drivers; together they earn 490 Laris per month. Her daughter in law is a teacher in a local school. 

Total average income of the family is 1000 Laris. Mzia requested credit for increasing stock in trade in her store. After increasing the assortment of the products, her turnover and consequently her profit will increase. Mzia plans to reinvest increased profits in the same business – she plans to renovate her store in order to become more competitive in the local market and attract more customers.

loans.use: to renovate her grocery store to become more competitive

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda.She is married with 5 children who all go to school. Margaret sells matooke (steamed green banana) from home on aretail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in business for the last 7 years. Margaret has requested a loan of 50000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspirations are to build rental houses and educate her children to university level and also to own a delivery van to ease transportation of bunches of bananas. Margaret lives in her own house but the family does not have access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches  of bananas

loans.name: Muhannad

texts.en:
Muhannad is a 28-year-old man who recently married Asmaa, a 25-year-old lady.

Having experience in working as a barber led Muhannad to open his own barber shop three years ago. Now Muhannad has a very good business reputation in his neighborhood and that’s why he is looking now to work on expanding his barber shop and include more seats. In the future he wants to open a branch in another area.

loans.use: To work on expanding his barber shop and include more seats.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Victoria se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tocos en diferentes partes de la ciudad. 
Solicita un para invertir en comprar materia para elaborar los guisados y comprar productos desechables como son platos, vaso y servilletas, y así atender mejor a sus clientes, al consumir sus alimentos este cómodos y confiables. 
Con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio planea pagar el crédito ya que es viuda y vive con un hijo que esta estudiando. 
Desea mejorar los ingresos de su negocio y de la familia.
texts.en: Victoria makes and sells tacos in various parts of the city.  She’s asking for a loan to buy ingredients to make the food and to buy disposable items like dishes, glasses and napkins to provide better service to her customers while they enjoy her food in comfort and safety. She plans to use part of her profits from the business to repay the loan since she’s a widow and lives with a son who’s going to school.  She wants to improve her business’ and her family’s income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make tacos.

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 39 years old, married and father of one child. He lives with his family and brothers, three of whom work.

Abdallah has owned an electric generator since 2009, leasing electric lines for his area and surrounding areas. He has sufficient experience in this field and has a good reputation in his area.

He decided to apply for a loan of $2400 in order to build a room for generators. He is aiming to gain more profits to allow him to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to build a room for generators.

loans.name: Alan Augusto

texts.es:
Alan tiene 27 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos. Vive en casa de su madre quien reside en la región Piura.  Reside en el Caserío Guaraguaos Alto en el distrito de Tambogrande, ubicado a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque. Alan vive en la parte rural  de este distrito y  cuenta con servicio de luz.

Alan se dedica a la crianza de ganado menor (ovinos, porcinos y aves de corral), los cuales al alcanzar tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa en el mercado local, esta actividad la desarrolla desde hace 3 años, además se dedica a la agricultura, trabajando con su hermano mayor, sembrando marigol y maíz.  Paralelamente es peón agrícola en los fundos del caserío

Alan desea comprar alimentos balanceados para el engorde de ganado y aves con la finalidad de lograr mejor tamaño y peso en menos tiempo, es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles en Edpyme Alternativa para lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Alan is 27 years old. He is single and doesn’t have children. He lives in the house of his mother, who lives in the Piura region, in the small town of Guaraguaos Alto, in the district of Tambogrande, which is located 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the department of Lambayeque. Alan lives in the rural area of this district and has electricity.

Alan raises small livestock (sheep, pigs, and domestic fowl). When they reach an ideal size and weight, he sells them in the local market. He has been in this business for 3 years. He also works in agriculture, working with his older brother to plant sunflowers and corn. He also works as an agricultural laborer on farms in the town.

Alan wants to buy feed for fattening his livestock and fowl with the goal of getting them to a better size and weight in less time. For this reason he has decided it would be a good idea to obtain a loan of PEN 1,000.00 from Edpyme Alternativa so he can achieve his goal.

loans.use: to buy feed to fatten his livestock

loans.name: Merla

texts.en:
Merla is a married woman who is 39 years old. She lives in Campo 5, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Merla owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She's been in this business for five years. Each month she earns 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional stock of goods to sell. Merla has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Merla wants to build a house and to finish her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of goods to sell

location.town: Campo 5, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
Faustina es socia del Banco Comunal “Brisas del Lago”  ubicado en el distrito,  provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 52 años de edad, es soltera, tiene cuatro hijos independientes.
Estudió educación superior pero no pudo terminarlo.

La señora se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, gaseosas, helados y gelatinas, trabaja más de seis años con Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo invirtió en su negocio venta de abarrotes.

Faustina solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 600.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizará para comprar mercaderías como chocolates, gaseosas, galletas, etc, sus hijos le ayudan en el negocio, también cuenta con servicio telefónico (cabina).

La señora desea seguir y mejorar su negocio para incrementar sus ganancias.
 
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la unión, la distracción con las socias y las charlas educativas respecto al negocio.
texts.en:
Faustina is a member of the "Brisas del Lago" communal bank, located in the province and department of Puno. She is 52, single, and has four independent children.
She was studying toward a degree in higher education but was unable to finish.
Faustina sells groceries, pop, ice cream and jell-o. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for over six years. She invested her first loan in her grocery store.
Faustina is requesting a new loan of 600 nuevo soles, which she will use to buy merchandise such as chocolate, pop, cookies, etc. Her children help her with the business. She also has a telephone booth.
She wants to continue to improve her business in order to increase her income.
What she most likes about her communal bank is its unity, having fun with the members, and the educational talks about business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as chocolates, pop, cookies, etc.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman with five children; four attend school, while one is too young for school.  Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the family's needs.  She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

Esther has operated a vegetable farm for the past three years; her potential clients are food stall owners in the local market.  She faces a major challenge of competition from other farmers.  She dreams of expanding her business and selling poultry and cattle.

With the Kshs 10,000 loan she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feed for her new poultry business.  She decided to join Yehu to access capital for expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feeds for her new poultry business.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea, age 46, is married and resides in Kampong Chnang Province. Chea sells fruits, and her husband is a construction worker. Chea is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a plot of farmland on which to grow watermelons and peanuts. 

In the future, Chea would like to use the additional income to purchase palm sugar to sell. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner. Chea appears in the photograph at KREDIT's office.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland on which to grow watermelons and peanuts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy silk threads of different colours.

loans.name: Vinh

texts.en:
Vinh is 52 years old and married.  She resides with her husband and six children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area which is well known for its historical tourism sites (such as the ancient temples of Angkor Wat, Bayon, and Banteay Srey). 

Vinh has been a basket weaver for over five years. Her husband has been involved in breeding cattle to sell for a profitable price for over three years and is successful in his career. Two of her children are employed as construction workers. Due to the difficulty in traveling to work, Vinh is requesting a loan of US $900 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work. In the future, she would like renovate her house and support her children to study until they get bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work

loans.name: Mougnou Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Mougnou sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogames avec en moyenne 26 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent dans le quartier Bagadadji de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles font  le petit commerce de pagnes wax, céréales (niébé, riz et mil), fruits (mangues) et des articles divers. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, elles adhérent Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Kadia Baro (1ère femme sur la photo de la gauche vers la droite) a une grande réputation dans la vente de pagnes wax à Bagadadji surtout dans la fourniture des uniformes lors des cérémonies de mariage et de baptême.                                                                                                                 Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 6 pièces de pagnes wax au grand  marché de Ségou. La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit à domicile, en ambulant et au marché Bagadadji de Ségou à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Madame Kadia Baro compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer les besoins du foyer en condiments.

loans.use: Pour  acheter des pagnes wax.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a married man with five children in addition to two other dependants. George deals in planting seedlings in nursery beds, particulary coffee seedlings. He has been advanced a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to restock seedlings for sale. The client says there's an urgent need and demand for coffee seedlings in his area and he needs to stock more for sale. He hopes to expand his nursery beds from the profits he will make from the sales. He is very hard working.

loans.use: To restock seedlings for sale

loans.name: Télé

texts.fr: Telé est une femme mariée âgée de 34 ans qui vit à Adidogomè. Ayant un enfant à charge, Telé est une marchande de sachets en plastique, de sucre. Telé s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend dans un autre emplacement là. Pour commander des paquets de sachets en plastique, des douzaines de sacs et des sacs de sucres, Telé nécessite ce fonds pour financer son approvisionnement en vue de bien revendre et de réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire afin de pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et mieux couvrir les frais scolaire de ses enfants.

loans.use: Acheter 08 paquets de sachets plastiques, 10 douzaines de sacs, de sacs bafana et 06 sacs de sucre.

loans.name: Shakhla

texts.en:
This 42-year-old woman is married, has 2 children, lives in Absheron region Hovsan settlement.
She has been engaged in this business for 7 years.
For the first time she borrowed a loan of $700 and bought cloth.
Now she needs a loan of $1100 to buy a new sewing-machine. Her sewing-machine is old and bad works. This machine has been  broken very often and it disturbs her to work. 
She plans to buy the new  sewing-machine in order to increase number of her clients.
.

loans.use: To buy a sewing-machine

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Lizzie is 36 years old and married with 4 children who are in school. She had no formal education but has fought against all odds to get her children well educated. Towards this she has decided not to give birth anymore. Her resolve was given a boost with the 'TEACH' learning sessions of KRABAN in October 2006. She prepares kenkey and fried fish for sale in her community. She would like a KIVA loan to improve the conditions under which she serves her customers.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Don Ricardo has a locale in his home, from which he sells articles of necessity and school supplies. He began his business two years ago when he recieved a bonus from the company where he worked for $500 with which he started to work.

At the beginning he only sold vegetables and dry grains, which he bought on wholesale. These days, he continues to sell groceries, as well as other items. With the advantage of living in front of a school, he decided to sell school supplies and stationary, which attracted more customers.With the loan, Ricardo hopes to purchase more products and start a small line of toys, that he noticed were in high demand.

Ricardo is certain that this the loan opportunity he will increase his sales and improve the conditions of his store. Ricardo is 28 years old and has four children, one son who is "special needs" and two who go to school. His home is made of cement, and he is certain that with the prosperity of his business he will be able to give a better quality of life to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Don Ricardo tiene un local en su casa donde vende articulos de primera necesidad y artículos escolares. El empezó su negocio desde hace dos años cuando recibio utilidades de la empresa donde trabajaba $500 con los que comenzó a trabajar.

Al comienzo solo vendía legumbres y granos secos que compraba a precio de mayorista. En estos dias continúa vendiendo productos de abarrotes, ademas ha incrementado más productos y con la ventaja de vivir frente a una escuela decidio vender artículos escolares y papelería lo cual le ha traído mayor clientela. Con este prestamo Ricardo espera comprar más productos y y agregar una pequeña linea de juguetes que ha notado tiene gran demanda.

Ricardo confia que con la oportunidad del prestamo va a incrementar sus ventas y asi mejorar las condiciones del negocio que tiene. Ricardo tiene 28 años y 4 hijos de los cuales uno es niño especial y dos estudian su casa de cemento el tiene la certeza que con la prosperidad de su negocio podra dar a su familia una mejores opciones de vida.

loans.use: Buy more products for his store

loans.name: Celine

texts.en:
Born in 1958, Celine W. is married to Shadrack W. and is a mother of 7 children. Being unemployed and with the meager salary of her husband, they were unable to provide for the basic needs of their 7 children. Motivated by these difficulties, she joined GHAPE in 2001 and obtained a loan of $30 and since then has been able to invest and manage loan amounts up to $230. With these loans, she paid her children's school fees and provided a balanced diet for her children.

Given a loan of $600, she plans to sell cooked food, rear pigs and sell firewood. The fact that she is known by most hawkers and laborers as a good cook is of advantage as this increases the number of her clients. With the profit, she will pay school fees for her children and provide for other basic needs. The fact that she sells firewood in her community will reduce indiscriminate exploitation of forests for firewood.

She plans to repay her loan in 24 months and the first installment of repayment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase rice, cocoyam, piglets, firewood, and other foodstuffs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in seafood and pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy raw ingredients to cook and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy car for transportation

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en: R. Mavluda lives in Nau, Tajikistan. She is married and has 4 children. R. Mavluda became a client of  MicroInvest in 2003 after hearing many successful stories from friends who started their own businesses with loans from MicroInvest.  She is engaged in selling grits (buckwheat, rice, pea, green gram etc) and has her own outlet in the food bazaar. Now Mrs. R. Mavluda requests a loan of 1500 STJ for the purchase of new goods.

loans.use: For the purchase of new goods

loans.name: Melchora

texts.es:
Melchora is a native of the Cupi zone. From a young age, she has been in continuous contact with the noble job of cattle raising. She learned and inherited this trade from her parents, who dedicated most of their lives to this job. This generous mother, along with her husband Carlos and their five dependent children, raise young calves and sheep for a living. Thanks to the diligence that they employ day to day when looking after and feeding their cattle, they are quickly managing to multiply their cattle. This hardworking mother’s wish is to buy another calf so that she can take care of her and provide her with food. In the future, she would like to get milk, which she will give to her young children, from this cow. With this goal in mind, she appeals to your good heart in search of your help.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase of a calf

loans.name: Zoila Rosa

texts.en:
Zoila Rosa Y. D. runs a wood and lumber distribution business in Pucallpa, Ucayali. The business specializes in the sale of Quina, Bolinas, Caliora, and Marupa woods, all of which are native to the tropical region of Ucayali. The business is family-owned and employs many workers.

Zoila is 44 years old, has 4 children, and is happily married. She is busy all day long taking care of her family, home, and business. Family is the most important part of her life. She is driven to make sure all of her children study and attend university.

A member of Manuela Ramos and the community bank Ricardo Palma, Zoila is requesting a loan of s/3000 to repay over 6 months.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for a lumber business

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
Mrs. Rina Y. and her husband were married last year and just had their first child. They live with her mother and two brothers, who work full-time in Phnom Penh, on an island on Mekong River about 15 kilometers from the city.

For the last 10 years, Mrs. Rina has made a living weaving silk, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her products to a middleman in her village, who sells them in Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Rina is requesting a loan of $300 to buy a motorbike for her brother use to work in Phnom Penh.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for brother use at work.

loans.name: Ioana

texts.en:
Ioana T., 45, is married with 7 children. She has 4 years of experience in the taro business. She sells to the villagers and the public 2 days per week. She will use her loan to purchase a back sprayer and transportation fares for her business and items for home improvement, including a toilet set(bowl), cement, nails, and sand.

Ioana has had 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 150 Tala (about $US62). SPBD loans are Ioana’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To invest in a taro business and home improvements

loans.name: Diadiaratou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Diadiaratou B. is a 38 year old married woman with 5 children and lives with her husband and their children in a monogamous family in the Banconi district in the city of Sikasso.

Not having gone to school due to economic reasons, she decided to start a revenue-generating business, namely the sale of cooking oil made from peanuts. She has run this business for 6 years. To obtain sufficient financial resources, she took on a loan from Soro Yiriwaso through the association SORO YIRIWASO of Banconi. She is on her third individual loan, thanks to 6 years of transparent collaboration. The turnover of her business is very high, and she realizes a monthly profit of 55,000 FCFA.

With this loan, she intends to buy 3 barrels of oil from the oil production factories in Sikasso and Bobo Douilasso (a town in the Republic of Burkina Faso in West Africa). Then, she will send this merchandise to the local market in Banconi using standard means of transportation. The sale is carried out generally to the women who frequent the market. She hopes to obtain a monthly profit of 85,000 FCFA, which will contribute as a rule to her family's expenses (food, clothing, and health).

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Madame Diadiaratou B. est une femme mariée de 38 ans et mère de 5 enfants et vit avec son époux et leurs enfants dans une famille monogame au quartier Banconi de la ville de Sikasso.

N’étant pas allé à l’école pour des raisons économiques, elle décida de mener une activité génératrice de revenus notamment la vente de l’huille alimentaire à base d’arachide. Elle mène cette activité maintenant dépuis 6 ans. Pour obtenir des ressources financières suffisantes, elle emprunta auprès de Soro Yiriwaso à travers l’association SORO YIRIWA de Banconi .Elle est à son troisième pret indivuduel pour 6 ans de franches collaborations La rotation de son activité est très élévée et elle réalise un bénéfice mensuel de 55 000 F CFA.

Avec ce pret, elle compte acheter 3 futs d’huile auprès des usines de production d’huile de Sikasso et de Bobo Douilasso (une ville de la République de Burkina Faso en Afrique de l’Ouest). Ensuite elle achemine les marchandises au marché local de Banconi avec les moyens de transport classiques. La vente est effectuée en détail généralement aux femmes qui fréquentent ce marché. Ellle espère sur un benefice mensuel de 85 000 FCFA qui contribuera comme d’habitude aux dépenses de la famille (nourriture, habillement et sante).

loans.use: To buy peanut oil

loans.name: Mujeres Decidida De Restauracion Group

texts.en: Maria M. is the leader of her Bank of Hope, Mujeres Decidida D. Restauracion ("Women Determined for Restoration").  She is the mother of four, aged 24, 26, 28, and 30, and has used her Esperanza loan to start her craft-selling business.  Her future ambitions incluD. expanding her business and providing a comfortable life for her grandchildren.

loans.use: Manualidades Nazareno (Christian crafts)

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Senora D. Clases is a humble woman. Together with her ten year old daughter, they work making and selling traditional clothing. Her husband is always away working, and so she must take care of the children and play the role of both mother and father for her family.

Sra. D. Clase muy humilD., juntamente con su hijita D. 10 años se dedican a la comercializacion D. centros para señoras D. pollera es su hijita quien le ayuda a la señora, su esposo se encuentra constantemente D. viaje, por lo tanto la sra. Es quien mantiene a todos sus hijos y tiene el rol D. padre y madre al mismo tiempo.

loans.use: To purchase fabric needed to make the traditional skirts she sells.

loans.name: Luz Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora Luz Esperanza, socia del Banco Comunal “Picota”, vive en la región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Picota. Se dedica a la venta de pasamanería, útiles escolares, ropa y productos de belleza. El negocio está ubicado en su propio domicilio, situado en el Jr. San Martín s/n, lugar donde acuden los clientes que en su mayoría son sus amigos y los vecinos de su barrio.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, invertirá en la compra de productos en oferta como desodorante, esmalte, shampoo, perfume y joyas, también en pasamanería como cierres, hilos de todos los colores, blondas, y útiles escolares como cuadernos, cola, lapiceros, lápices, etc. Quiere que su negocio este bien surtido para atender las necesidades de los clientes.

Luz tiene 44 años, vive con su esposo, quien la apoya en las decisiones que toma. Ella es una persona responsable y con mucho poder de decisión. Le gusta el negocio y quiere más adelante contar con una zapatería.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luz Esperanza, a member of the communal bank "Picota", lives in the San Martín region of Peru in the province and district of Picota. She works selling sewing trim, school supplies, clothing and beauty products.The business is located in her home on Jr. San Martín. The friends and neighbors who are her clients come to her site to make their purchases. With this loan for 1500 Peruvian soles, which she will repay in 6 monthly payments, she will invest in the purchase of products such as deoderant, fingernail polish, shampoo, perfume and jewelry as well as sewing supplies such as zippers, a variety of threads, laces and school supplies including notebooks, glue, ballpoint pens, pencils, etc. She wants her business to be well stocked in order to serve her clients' needs. Luz is 44 years old and lives with her husband, who supports her decisions. She is a responsible and decisive person. She likes business and wants to someday own a shoestore.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products, school supplies, etc.

loans.name: Corépa 2 Group

texts.fr: Nous les femmes du Gie Corépa 2 de l'écovillage Palmarin (http://www.sem-fund.org/palmarinfr.php) remercient Kiva de leur avoir fait confiance. Cependant, elles reviennent auprès de Kiva solliciter un renouvellement de prêt d'un montant de 700 000 F qui leur permettra de continuer leurs activités de teinture. Avec le prêt, elles vont acheter beaucoup de  tissus pour agrandir leur stock, du matériel pour la teinture. Avec ces tissus, elles vont coudre des habits qui seront mis en vente dans les établissements touristes de l'écovillage et ensuite exportés vers la capitale "Dakar" pour une plus rapide liquidation du produit.
texts.en:
