Her eldest daughter sews clothes for her neighboring clients and the other two children are studying at a local school. 

Yasmeen is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She is a very supportive lady who tries her best to provide relief to her family with her work. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s business. With the loan, he will purchase items such as spices, cooking oil, lentils, rice, etc. to prepare larger quantities of food to sell in his restaurant. Yasmeen is confident that an investment in her husband’s business will be a good step towards its growth. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. With her previous loan, she established good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Yasmeen.

loans.use: to buy spices, cooking oil, lentils, rice, etc. to prepare food to sell

loans.name: Juana Aura

texts.es:
Doña Juana Aura, es casada, tiene 48 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos, 2 de los cuales estan estudiando, se dedica a la confección de tejidos, sudaderos, pants, playeras, etc. lleva 11 años de experiencia, inició siendo operaria, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien se dedica al comercio.

Quiere ampliar su producción, para lo cual acude ASDIR pra solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para ampliar su capital de trabajo, ya que esta vez va a comprar: telas, hilos, correas, etiquetas, etc, las cuales son materiales necesarios e importantes en la producción de su negocio, ya que sin este material no tendría forma de producir mas prendas. Espera alcanzar su objetivo con el préstamo que esta realizando.
texts.en:
Juana Aura is married, 48 years old and has 4 children, two of which are students.  She has 11 years of experience making knitted fabrics, sweaters, pants, t-shirts etc.  Initially, she worked as a machine operator.  She has the support of her husband who works in business. 

Juana wishes to increase her production, and in order to achieve this she requesting a loan that she will use as capital to buy fabric, thread, ribbon, labels, etc, which are all important, necessary items for her business.  Without these items she would not have a way of making more clothing.  She hopes to reach her goals through the loan that she is requesting.

loans.use: buy materials to make clothing

loans.name: Laura Patricia

texts.es:
Laura es soltera, tiene 26 años de edad y es comerciante. Comenta que empezó trabajando  hace más de 5 años, y que con la de sus padres  consiguió  el capital para la compra de sus primeras mercaderías. 
Actualmente cuenta con variedad de ropas y con más de 150 clientes con quienes trabaja día a día  para sacar adelante a toda su familia.  
Ha decidido confiar en la Fundacion Paraguaya y en Kiva, y solicita el préstamo para la compra de mayor cantidad de ropas de abrigo, ya que actualmente cuenta con un gran número de pedidos. 
Ella ha decidido llegar a su meta en esta etapa, como se dedica también a la venta de cremas, su objetivo ahora es poseer su propia tienda de venta de ropas.
texts.en:
Laura is 26 years old and single.  She is a salewoman.  She tells us that she started working more than five years ago and received capital from her parents in order to buy her first lot of merchandise.

Currently, Laura sells a variety of clothes and has more than 150 customers with whom she works every day.  This enables her to get her family ahead in life.

Laura decided to come to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva in order to request a loan to buy a larger quantity of clothes and coats since she currently has a large number of orders.  Laura also sells creams.  Her goal is to own her own clothes store.

loans.use: to buy coats and pants

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
For the last 21 years, Nancy has been practicing farming in Ndunyu Njeru town. She is 46 years old single mother of two school age children.

She got to know about KADET LTD through various marketing activities carried out by KADET staff in Ndunyu Njeru. This will be her third loan. She paid her previous loan of KES 30,000 in full and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seedlings and fertilizers, and to pay for farm labor and for spraying chemicals.

In the future, Nancy aspires to practice large scale farming in Ndunyu Njeru town

loans.use: To buy potato seedlings and fertilizers; to pay for farm labor and for  spraying chemicals.

loans.name: One Word Iii Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “One Word III” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Kabala, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Isatu. Isatu is age 20; she was born in northern Sierra Leone. Isatu currently resides in Kabala town together with her husband and one child. Isatu sells salt, fish, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), tomatoes, rice, sugar, etc. She has been a businesswoman for 3 years now. With her share of this loan, Isatu is going to buy the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy salt, fish, margi, tomatoes, rice, sugar, etc. in bulk for sale

loans.name: Seyram

texts.fr: Responsable d’un salon de coiffure, Seyram a 29ans. Elle vend des mèches et défrisant qu’elle achète au Grand Marché de Lomé à ses clientes. Célibataire, Seyram sollicite ce prêt pour acheter 05 cartons de mèches et 18 boites de défrisant.
texts.en: Seyram is 29 years old and manages a hair salon. She sells hair extensions and hair relaxer, which she buys at the Grand Market in Lomé, to her clients. Unmarried, Seyram is seeking this loan to buy five boxes of hair extensions and 18 cans of hair relaxer.

loans.use: To buy hair extensions and relaxer.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel who is married with two school aged children is now 40 years old.  He is a farmer who has been engaged in rice production for 30 years.  He is doing his best to improve his ways in farming to create more income. 

Samuel is asking for a loan of PHP 27,000 to buy seeds of rice to be planted in his 1.0 hectare rice field and fertilizers (the organic kind made from animal manures) for the maintenance of his crop. 

By continuing to work towards the development of his farming, Samuel hopes to see his children finish their studies in college.  Furthermore, he is doing his best to uplift his family from their poor living situation.

loans.use: to buy seeds of rice to be planted in his 1.0 hectare rice field and fertilizers (the organic kind made from animal manures) for the maintenance of his crop.

loans.name: Claudina

texts.en:
Claudina lives in Choluteca, Honduras, where she is engaged in a variety of small businesses. She sells clothing out of her home, and she also prepares bread and tamales, which she sells. 

Claudina is requesting a loan of HNL 10,000 to purchase merchandise as well as ingredients for cooking. She hopes to continue working with Prisma in the future in order to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, pants, shirts, blouses, boxer shorts, swimwear, watches, flour, sugar, yeast, corn and rice.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema lives in Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (a sister and her children). Rehema has a food stall. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week. Rehema sells her products at the market, by means of retail. 

Rehema has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy to more bunches of bananas, cassava and Irish potatoes. The main business challenges for Rehema include seasonality, thieves and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling on a wholesale basis only and also to start going to villages for foodstuffs. 

Rehema lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, cassava and Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Emy Grace

texts.en:
Emy Grace is 35 years old, married, and has three children who attend school. They live in a village to manage their rice farming business. They work hard and endures hardships for they want to continue sending their children to school. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, they are experiencing a financial shortage. 

In this regard, they want to increase their yields to earn a higher income to support the education of their children and to acquire their basic necessities. Due to lack of capital, Emy Grace is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides and to pay labor cost required in rice production. They believe that through patience and hard work, they will increase their yields and income.

In the future, Emy Grace hopes that they will become financially stable and all their children will earn a degree.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides and to pay labor costs required in rice production.

loans.name: Burmakan

texts.ru: Бурмакан 44 года, вдова, имеет троих детей. Так как Бурмакан является единственным кормильцем для своей семьи, она прилагает все усилия для обеспечения своих детей всем необходимым. В 1996 году Бурмакан начала свой бизнес в торговле. В 2005 году, взяв кредит в сумме 22,000 сом (KGS), Бурмакан выбрала направление  в торговле детской одежды и отработала кредит своевременно и без просрочек. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бурмакан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS). На полученные средства она планирует расширить ассортимент предоставляемых товаров. На частичные доходы от кредита, Бурмакан планирует сделать хороший ремонт дома.
texts.en: Burmakan is 44 years old, a widow and has three children.  Because Burmakan is the only provider for her family, she uses all her efforts to support all of her children's needs.  She started her retail business in 1996.  Having taken out a loan in the sum of 22,000 som (KGS) in 2005, Burmakan chose to focus on sales of children's clothing and repaid that loan in a timely manner and without delays.  To further develop her business, Burmakan went to the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to request a loan in the sum of 70,000 som (KGS).  She plans to use the obtained funds to expand her merchandise selection.  Burmakan also plans to use part of the income from the loan to make quality repairs to her house.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of goods

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es:
Don Manuel tiene 34 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida y tres hijos.

Él es un hombre trabajador, que desde la edad de 13 años inicio a trabajar en la agricultura con su padrastro, ya que eran de escasos recursos económicos no pudo asistir a la escuela sino que le toco empezar a trabajar en el cultivo de maíz.

Don Manuel tiene que caminar durante 15 minutos a la orilla de un rió, para llegar a la carretera principal y abordar un carro en donde viaja en la palangana de este durante 45 minutos hasta llegar a la ciudad donde compra los insumos que necesita para realizar sus cultivos.

Él esta solicitando un préstamo a Fundacion Campo para, comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios para sembrar una manzana de maíz. Don Manuel con su producción venderá una parte obteniendo los ingresos necesarios, para pagar el préstamo y el resto lo ahorrara, la otra parte de la cosecha la almacenara para la alimentación de su familia. Con esto él estaría ahorrando, ya que los productos de la canasta básica son altos y estaría asegurando la alimentación de su familia.

El sueño de don Manuel es, ahorrar para construirles a sus hijos una casa de ladrillo, por que la que tienen es de bahareque.
texts.en:
Manuel is 34 and lives with his common-law partner and three children.

He is a hard worker who at age 13 began working in agriculture with his step-father.  They had little income so he was not able to go to school but he did begin growing corn.

Manuel must walk 15 minutes every day along the riverbank to get to the main road where he boards a vehicle that will take him along the highway for 45 minutes to the city where he buys supplies for his crops.

He is requesting a loan through the Fundación Campo to buy what he needs to plant corn.  Manuel will sell part of his produce to obtain the funds necesary to pay back the loan and the rest will be saved.  The other part of the harvest will be stored for family consumption.  This means he will be saving money because the price of staple goods is high and he will be able to feed his family.

Dom Manuel's dream is to save enough to build a brick house for his children.  The one they have now is made of "bahareque" ( wattle and daub).

loans.use: To buy farm supplies to plant corn.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is 56 years old and is currently in a relationship. She has four children.

Eufemia has for the last three years prepared and sold food. She makes lunch and breakfast. She started off small and then started to grow thanks to the recommendations of her customers to other people. In this way she grew her business a little at a time. She considers herself to be a good cook. She says that she starts preparing the food very early every day.

She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients to make her meals such as chicken, flour, noodles, rice and other products. In the future she hopes that she can establish a restaurant so that she can cover the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables and spices used for cooking meals to sell.

loans.name: Claudia  Margarita

texts.es: La Sra. Claudia  es una persona  trabajadora  y  muy  responsable la  cual se  esfuerza  por  sacar a  su  familia adelante, actualmente  se  dedica  a la  elaboración  y  venta  de piñatas, en esta  ocasión  requiere  de nuestro  apoyo para  realizar  la compra de material para  seguir  realizando  las piñatas , ve  en el crédito la  posibilidad de  hacer  crecer  su  negocio, generando  mayores  ingresos y  brindando  a  sus  hijos   una  excelente estabilidad  económica.
texts.en:
Claudia is a hard-working and very responsible person who has made an effort to get her family ahead.

Currently she makes and sells piñatas and now needs our help to buy materials so she can continue making them.  She sees the possibility of having her business grow with the loan, generating more income and offering her children great economic stability.

loans.use: to buy material to make piñatas

loans.name: Gracious Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Masvingo. This is 46 year old Simbiso. She is married and has 4 children aged 23, 20, 14 and 9. All her children are going to school and her husband is a teacher at Mudhenge Primary School. 

Her business is based at home. She does the marketing of her products by herself around town. She does not have any employees. She buys her clothes and perfumes from Tanzania and Zambia. The challenge she faces in her business is that some debtors fail to pay on time. With the profits from her business she would like to refurbish her house.

She would want to own a retail shop in the next five years.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and clothes for sale

loans.name: 2 De Noviembre (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En  la ciudadela 15 De Abril en la ciudad de Portoviejo ciudad de gente honesta y trabajadora con una gran variedad  en su gastronomía y con un clima variable y agradable, cada 15 días se reúnen  los socios  del Banco Comunal 2 De Noviembre. Los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio en general, servicios, entre otras cosas. Ellos unieron sus esfuerzos para poder acceder a los beneficios que presta la Fundación Espoir, este es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal  y esperan cumplir muy bien para seguir adelante en la institución.

En este lugar conocimos a don Sergio, tiene 44 años de edad, está divorciado y tiene 4 hijos, dos mayores y dos de 16 y 14 años de edad que estudian en colegio, todos sus hijos viven con él.
 
El se dedica al comercio, vende remedios y productos naturales, recorre la ciudad ofreciendo sus productos y también se desplaza a otras ciudades para realizar sus ventas, trabaja todos los días ya que según él, si no trabaja como mantiene a sus hijos, sus productos los compra en un local de la ciudad y vende productos tanto nacionales como del extranjeros, lleva más de 23 años en este negocio y  tiene mucha clientela que siempre le compran ya que sus productos son muy buenos.

Este crédito es para comprar remedios y productos naturales. Este es su primer  ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la rapidez para conseguir los créditos.

Su sueño es tener un gran local en el centro. 

La señora con una camiseta turquesa que aparece en la foto en la última fila, arimada a una puerta negra es familiar de una de las socias y no pertenece al grupo.
texts.en:
In the April 15th neighborhood of the city of Portoviejo, one can find honest and hardworking people, a wide variety of cuisines, and a variable and pleasant climate. The members of the November 2nd Communal Bank meet every 15 days. They engage in different businesses in retail, services, and other sectors. The members have joined forces so that they can access the benefits provided by Fundación ESPOIR. This is their first loan cycle as a Communal Bank and they hope to do well so that they can move forward with the organization.

It is here that one can meet Don Sergio. He is 44 years old, divorced, and has four children. Two of them are grown and the other two (ages 16 and 14) attend high school. All of his children live with him.

Sergio is a merchant who sells remedies and natural products. He travels around the city offering his products. Sergio also visits other cities in order to make sales. He works every day and, according to him, would not able to support his children if he was not working. His products are purchased at a store in the city and then sold nationally and abroad. Sergio has been in business for more than 23 years and has many customers who always buy his products because they are very good.

This loan will be used to buy remedies and natural products. Sergio is in his first loan cycle with the Communal Bank and he enjoys the speed by which he was able to secure the loan. His dream is to have a large shop in the downtown area.

The woman in the turquoise shirt and standing in the back row of the photograph is a relative of one of the members. She does not belong to the group.

loans.use: to buy remedies and natural products.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children.
 
Aida has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of 11,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Aida has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Aida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Roxana Teresa

texts.es:
Roxana es socia del Banco Comunal “Brisas del Lago”  ubicado en la provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 38 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene tres hijos.  Cuenta con estudios de educación superior.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos  desde hace dos años, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio venta de abarrotes.

Solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 1200.00 nuevo soles dinero que invertirá en la compra de víveres, golosinas, panetones, leche, chocolates, todo para la campaña navideña.
En el negocio le ayuda su hija, la señora también trabaja en el Municipio de la zona.

Sueña con tener un negocio grande, una casa propia y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
 
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones, la distracción y el compañerismo con las socias.
texts.en:
Roxana belongs to the “Brisas del Lago” (Lake Breezes) communal bank located in Puno Province and Department.  She’s 38 years old, has a spouse and three children.  She attended higher education.  

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for two years.  Her first loan was for 500 new soles that she invested in her grocery store.  She will request a new, 1200 new sol, loan to use to buy foodstuffs, snacks, panettones, milk, chocolate; everything for the Christmas season.  Her daughter helps her in the business.

She dreams with having a larger business, with having her own house and that her children become professionals.  What she enjoys the most about her communal bank is the meetings, the entertainment and the companionship with her fellow members.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is a married woman with three school going children.  Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the welfare of his family.  She lives in a rental house with piped water but no electricity.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Peninah has operated a grocery for the past 10 years.  Her clients are her neighbors.  She faces a major challenge of transporting her stock from point of purchase to her place of sale.  Peninah dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 25,000 loan Peninah wants to purchase more tomatoes, potatoes, cabbage, onion and carrots for resale.  She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more tomatoes, potatoes, cabbage, onion and carrots for resale.

loans.name: Ros' Group

texts.en: This group is made up of six members. The leader is Ros, who is 47 years old and lives in Kampong Chhnang province. Each member will use his/her portion of the loan for a different purpose. Mr. Ros, who works in an agricultural business, will use his loan to purchase merchandise inventory for his wife's store, located in their house. This loan will sustain and enhance this business and enable it to be more successful. He is very grateful for the support to his family and his group members. He hopes that everyone in his group will improve their businesses through the loan.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise inventory

loans.name: Jose Leonardo

texts.es:
José, necesita fortalecer su negocio por eso se ha decidido a solicitar un nuevo préstamo e invertirlo en el pago de mozos para la recolección de la cosecha de maíz, espera que con el dinero de este préstamo pueda cancelar los gastos necesarios para el proceso de la cosecha y hacerla llegar hasta la vivienda de su familia.
El tuvo un efecto positivo con un préstamo anterior, logrando de comprar nuevas mercaderia para el negocio de su esposa y también ha contribuido con los gastos de su familia y que sus hijos continúen sus estudios.
texts.en:
José has decided to seek a new loan so that he can strengthen his business. He wishes to hire young men to help with the corn harvest. He also wants to pay for the expenses associated with the harvest and then put the money earned into the family’s home.

José believes that the previous loan had a positive effect. He managed to buy new merchandise for his wife’s business, contributed to family expenses, and his children were able to continue with their education.

loans.use: to hire young men to help with the corn harvest

loans.name: Ritchie

texts.en:
Ritchie is married with 2 children. Ritchie is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines.

To earn a living, Ritchie has a retail business. She has had this business for 2 years. Each month she earns approximately 4,000 PHP. She has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store. Ritchie has been a member of PMPC for 1 year.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: 3.14.155.thiệu Khánh Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chút has a retail business selling dried food. She is requesting a loan to purchase eggs to resell.

Chút is 59 years old and she is married with 3 children. Chút is the group leader of the 3.14.155.Thiệu Khánh solidarity group, which consists of 9 members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

This is Chút's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Chút has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main harship that Chút faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profits, Chút hopes to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, for her children to find good jobs, and to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase eggs to sell

loans.name: Natia

texts.en:
Natia is 24 years young woman from Telavi. She has pensioner grandmother and husband, who is a private artisan and gets some income. In the region there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make living.  So, Natia decided to start her own business with the loan but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. Her credit requests were rejected several times, as she was unable to satisfy their requirements. She received the credit in the framework of joint initiative of Kiva and Credo - Startup Program that gives people the chance to start or re-start businesses.  Natia taught the work of a stylist and now needs money to purchase all tools and start working. 
This will give her a chance to earn income and become financially independent. Regards with the Start Up program she will be able to make savings and provide better future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase tools and start working as a stylist

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rice Cultivation

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary L. was born on December 24, 1973 in Padhe district which is located in the northern part of Uganda. She is a responsible widow with a daughter age 13 in primary seven. Mary was forced to stop her own studies very young because her parents died and this left no one to pay her school fees. The parents died when there was crossfire between LRA rebels and the Government troops in 1986.

In 2003 Mary became involved with the Charity for Peace night commuter center where she was handling over 2,500 kids who come there seeking night shelter because they fear the rebel group called the LRA. Mary volunteered as a caregiver for the children and became a member of Life in Africa when they opened the WE Center on the Charity of Peace property. This is a real voluntary service that she performed without payment.

During the daytime, Mary is a committed farmer, and she also does some petty businesses in the market place after her garden work is finished. She does well, but she now needs to expand her business to increase her savings, especially since her daughter will enter high school next year.

Mary is seeking a loan in the amount of 250,000/= (USD 150). This money will make it possible to buy more goods for her produce business to add to what she grows, and it will provide her with a store in which to sell her goods. She is confident that with her experience she will be a success and will be able to provide more for her daughter. She believes she will be able to repay this loan in 6 months. She will be getting a profit of 135,000/= monthly from the business.

Below is her loan plan:-

04 Empty sacks : ................4,000/=Ushillings.

01Basin :........................3,000/=Ushillings .

05 Cups : ........................2,200/=Ushillings.

Store:...........................18,000/=U shillings.

Transport: .......................30,000/=U shillings.

Buying simsim:...................90,000/=Ushillings.

Buying 1 sack of beans :...........80,000 Ushillings.

Market dues :...............13,000 Ushillings per month.

Contigency:..........................9,800 Ushillings.

Total:...........................250,000/=Ushillings (US$ 150)

loans.use: Buying produce
